text: If Conservatives are in search of an open minded, consensual, pro-European caretaker leader - seems implausible - David Lidington is the man. In this TRG speech he defines self-doubt as true Conservative frame of mind.
author: patrickwintour

text: Love this one.
author: patrickwintour

text: As tens of thousands of march in London on Saturday to stop Brexit, Jeremy Corbyn will be 250 miles away unveiling Labour's ‘bold, ambitious’ blueprint for a brighter future for Morecambe.  Would Lancaster's future be immeasurably  brighter inside EU ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Labour deputy leader @tom_watson to speak at People's March tomorrow. Says he can only vote for a deal if the people have a vote on it too.  “That's why I'm proud to be marching. I trust the people I represent. And only they can sort this mess out.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Disagree. The true voice of doom on the BBC is @OrlaGuerin.   As soon as you hear her voice, you know the apocalypse has finally struck. With @bbclysedoucet there is sometimes a humanitarian worker, or a peace process on the horizon. Ps both brilliant btw.
author: patrickwintour

text: Understand Tony Blair gave one of his regular state of the nation reports this morning to European Ambassadors based in the UK. He told them there was an absence of leadership in the Conservative or Labour Party.  One dipole says not huge dissent in the room at this observation.
author: patrickwintour

text: Charities condemn UK over refusal to endorse Gaza deaths report
author: patrickwintour

text: The state of the UK is line one page one of Macron's anti-populist manifesto for the European elections.
author: patrickwintour

text: Don't share a meeting with Chuka, and don't share a demonstration with a Tory.  "I’m Labour’s NEC youth rep – and I won’t be at the People’s Vote march tomorrow" - LabourList via @LabourList
author: patrickwintour

text: is there anyone you have in mind ?
author: patrickwintour

text: A pressing prior appointment in the garden shed.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jess Phillips and David Lammy are so far the lead Labour speakers at the Peoples March on Saturday in London. Awaiting news on whether/if @johnmcdonnellMP or @tom_watson are going to bring solidarity and greetings from the shadow cabinet.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK will oppose all motions critical of Israel if brought under dedicated Article 7 procedure at the UN Human Rights Council. This is the UK's alternative to the US policy of withdrawing from HRC altogether. Denmark is joining UK policy. https://www.thejc.com/news/uk-news/jeremy-hunt-announces-uk-will-oppose-every-uh-human-rights-council-measure-on-israel-1.481834 … via @jewishchron
author: patrickwintour

text: A truly failed state looking to rescue itself   Libya envoy hopes reconciliation talks will bring stability.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt suggests if MPs reject May deal yet again next week then EU might attach conditions to offering a long extension, such as a second referendum, something he says MPs would reject.
author: patrickwintour

text: No wonder Europe is giving up all hope.
author: patrickwintour

text: French foreign minister Le Drian: "A situation in which Mrs May would not be able to present to the European Council sufficient guarantees about the credibility of her strategy would lead to the extension request being dismissed and opting for a no-deal exit."  V hardball.
author: patrickwintour

text: May told by Juncker not to put end June deadline in her letter and went ahead anyway. Why ? Who is advising her ?
author: patrickwintour

text: German Bundestag foreign affairs committee chairman and CDU member. Mrs May request is meaningless, and made without the authority of UK parliament.
author: patrickwintour

text: Worth recalling last Thursday in debate Labour front bench,  citing various legal opinions, said it would be legally possible for UK to stay in the EU beyond June, and not participate in the European Parliamentary elections.  UK Govt and many others disagree.
author: patrickwintour

text: Britain's nerve centre.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sure the issue surely is whether she is following the expressed view of parliament. Granted, you can look at either as executive v parliament, or parliament v people.
author: patrickwintour

text: You have certain knowledge of what the people think that few possess . Parliament by a large majority voted for the option of a long extension if necessary and was told by the cabinet minister responsible at the despatch box that it would be reckless to do otherwise.
author: patrickwintour

text: It matters as much what Tory Remain ministers do. No deal back on the table big time. There are indicative votes next week, but they are just that, indicative, and so not binding.
author: patrickwintour

text: A true constitutional crisis is when a prime minister acts in defiance of parliamentary vote and without any endorsement by cabinet. This is what PM is doing by not seeking option of longer extension, so trying to set up a last minute straight no deal/her deal choice.
author: patrickwintour

text: Even more incredibly tedious that smart people get taken off select committees so that "owned people" get appointed in their stead.
author: patrickwintour

text: Fascinating report on the secret effort in Berlin to reach across the community divide in Syria, and chart a common future  - "Syrian Sunni-Alawite Dialogue Forms Council to Implement Coexistence Agreement
author: patrickwintour

text: This, from the most senior civil servant at the foreign office, reveals the reassuring existence of a no deal Brexit war room. The focus is on helping UK citizens.
author: patrickwintour

text: That is a good point. Too many technologies telling editors for how long and how far people read specific stories. Things get cut.
author: patrickwintour

text: There is a quote from someone rubbishing the report. I come from an outmoded school of journalism where you report what people say with some context.
author: patrickwintour

text: This is now a little out of date.
author: patrickwintour

text: The whole highly profitable MV franchise threatened by Bercow ruling. Would Bercow regard Toy Story 3 substantially the same as Toy Story 2 ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Jacob Rees Mogg ready to climb down but next week after European Council when options clarified. Fears missing a golden constitutional opportunity to leave. A Euro-sceptic finally observes massive bird nestling in hand, rather than pining after two mythical birds in bush.
author: patrickwintour

text: A portrait of Britain's housing crisis, as described in one letter from a 11 year old to their local MP @stephenctimms.
author: patrickwintour

text: Ben Wallace security minister tells his ally Boris Johnson that security services want a Brexit deal."They are professionals. Should we fall headlong into a collapse in parliament or government, they would just despair".  Bit low to recruit security services to your politics.
author: patrickwintour

text: Yes, hope so.  The Guardian has written about the overseaes funding of the TPA quite extensively.
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign policy normally an after-thought in any UK party leadership contest. But UK's post Brexit role, including 0.7 % overseas aid target, could be critical in a Tory battle. Hunt, Johnson, Mordaunt and Patel all with FP backgrounds eying top job. Patel speaks on aid tomorrow.
author: patrickwintour

text: As Brexit gets ever more humiliating, MH gets ever more scintillating.  "Brexit – the niche production that truly brought the house down" | Marina Hyde.
author: patrickwintour

text: US Syria envoy Jeffrey presses UK to take back its foreign fighters and "deal with them either through prosecution, through reeducation, whatever their constitution and legal system allows, but we do not think it’s fair to keep these people simply under SDF control indefinitely".
author: patrickwintour

text: US announces it is imposing visa restrictions on any person that seeks, or co-operates with International Criminal Court inquiry into US actions, including US activity in Afghanistan. Says ICC is attacking US rule of law. New policy already being implemented.
author: patrickwintour

text: France says it has evacuated some foreign fighter children from North West Syria, something the British government has so far refused to do, citing security concerns. NW Syria held by UK allies.  Hunt said last Sunday some rescue was being considered. Since then silence.
author: patrickwintour

text: Held hostage in London by Britain's political chaos, the whip-defying UK foreign minister Alistair Burt is unable to travel to the Syria refugee donor conference in Brussels. Just a small example of how the Brexit preoccupation jars with Global Britain.
author: patrickwintour

text: Could she skip MV3, MV4, MV5 and go straight to MV6. Got a good feeling about MV6.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jordanian foreign minister says only 13,913 Syrian refugees out of 1.3m registered in Jordan have returned to Syria.  Adds "becoming a hard sell" to tell a Jordanian you are out of work because a Syrian has a job.  #syriaconf2019
author: patrickwintour

text: No.   Think he is fine.   He just did not say anything reportable. (sorry)
author: patrickwintour

text: He has found a special place in Limbo for us.
author: patrickwintour

text: You might think Government no longer exists, disintegrating in plain sight in successive votes.But May like Rasputin never quite dies. She has reframed choice for Brexiteers as between 2 year delay, or brief respite to vote again on her deal. Voice has expired but not her will.
author: patrickwintour

text: Upsetting news. Condolences to family.
author: patrickwintour

text: They want Malthouse to be the new Conservative leader ? Or have I got that wrong ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Good thoughts on what to do in Syria etc after ISIS has been wiped off the map, but not the mind.
author: patrickwintour

text: I agree - just pointing out it is going on. Dont think Italy Poland or Hungary would veto an extension so long as there was a plausible reason for extension
author: patrickwintour

text: should say I do not think this likely to happen. Eu has been impressively united, and not sure either Poland or Italy would wish to alienate Eu colleagues by vetoing an A 50 extension. Salvini and Poland have bigger budgetary issues in play. with EU.
author: patrickwintour

text: Number of Tory MPs went to see members of Polish governing party last week in Warsaw - broadly on same errand, namely to block Article 50 extension.
author: patrickwintour

text: Not sure that is right. A majority of MPs can legislate for a referendum, not just the government. We live in a parliamentary democracy.
author: patrickwintour

text: I am not the political editor and I did not say it was JC's fault, as you put it. If you ask,  I would have said it was Mrs Mays fault since she focussed on party unity rather than country unity.
author: patrickwintour

text: Rebecca Long-Bailey suggests Labour interested in unwhipped indicative votes - says Labour focus is on a Soft Brexit, adding easy to find consensus on this. 2nd referendum on table to stop Tory Brexit or No Deal Brexit. Not asked if supports referendum for any Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: will reply in morning, past my bedtime,
author: patrickwintour

text: Corbyn makes no mention of a second referendum as one of the options he wishes now to pursue. Focus instead is Brexit with a negotiated customs union and access to the single market. "Labour Source" back in control of policy.
author: patrickwintour

text: Inside the No Lobby - it's becoming over recent weeks THE place to meet and make new friends.
author: patrickwintour

text: Bit disappointing that the much anticipated Independence Day celebrations are being downgraded to "Best-turd-we-got" Day.  Slightly puts a dampener on things.
author: patrickwintour

text: Syria's neighbours press for help to return refugees
author: patrickwintour

text: Significant that all Permanent Members of the Security Council express concern at the state of the peace talks in Yemen, and the escalating fighting.
author: patrickwintour

text: In the background, one of the European Research Group's leading silks late for the meeting. At least we are blowing ourseleves up in true British style.
author: patrickwintour

text: Indeed next question is can May survive, if so does she try a third time, or does parliament take control by extending Article 50, and for how long and for what purpose. Some in EU want extension to cover enetire transition.There will be a try at Norway, and at a referendum.
author: patrickwintour

text: After a difficult few hours, the pound is now in recovery, sitting up and sipping tea.
author: patrickwintour

text: Cox says Bollocks again, but now at greater length. This is not a drill.
author: patrickwintour

text: Coded message to Boris. Looks ominous.
author: patrickwintour

text: Odd so much turns on route out of backstop, but worth reading this legal opinion by People's Vote campaign. At best Agreement "might be suspended in extreme circumstances of bad faith on the part of the EU which are highly unlikely to be demonstrated". https://assets.nationbuilder.com/in/pages/18197/attachments/original/1552382543/PV_Opinion_final_signed.pdf?1552382543 …
author: patrickwintour

text: Think we are going to do VAR.
author: patrickwintour

text: The Attorney General obviously not getting linage for his Opinion on the joint declaration.
author: patrickwintour

text: Titans, all of them.
author: patrickwintour

text: A real battle of hearts and minds underway amongst sceptics.  Does not feel as if they are just pretending to look down the ladder, but actually testing the top steps to see what it all feels like.
author: patrickwintour

text: A country deep in crisis, led by Theresa May, now awaits the verdict of Sir Bill Cash, Geoffrey Cox, & Nigel Dodds. What a hand we have dealt ourselves.
author: patrickwintour

text: Mrs May breakthrough, of sorts.  After spending weeks getting MPs to vote in favour of what the UK govt would ideally like to negotiate, she will now ask MPs to vote in favour of what the UK govt alone would like to believe it has negotiated.
author: patrickwintour

text: Radio 5 commentator “Mr Juncker is now speaking in ...what sounds like German”.  Masterly grasp of the European scene.
author: patrickwintour

text: If Dublin is calm, the DUP will by tomorrow be less calm.
author: patrickwintour

text: Steve Baker ERG The govt “ has put a very good gloss on what falls short of what was expected”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sajid Javid, home secretary, says time to update treason law in view of difficulty gaining evidence to prosecute UK fighters returning from Syria. Of 360 fighters returned to UK, just 40 so far prosecuted. This is Policy Exchange proposed treason reform. https://policyexchange.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Aiding-the-Enemy.pdf …
author: patrickwintour

text: Libyan army chief strengthens hand by taking more territory
author: patrickwintour

text: Lord Falconer still ready to conduct inquiry into Labour anti-semitism if ECHR drops its poss independent inquiry. Says he will have full access to papers, and Corbyn "willing to let me in with all the resources I need". Adds interventions in cases by leaders office needs inquiry
author: patrickwintour

text: Hunt says discussing with DFID about how UK govt can get children of British foreign fighters out of Syrian refugee camps. Says UK has been reluctant to send FO officials into a war zone. NB Refugee camps are run by Britain's allies. Number of refugees way above forecasts.
author: patrickwintour

text: John McDonnell claims Labour could secure deal in weeks, and avoids question 1) of how long any delay Labour support. 2) whether Thornberry right to back only 3 month extension, so making ref. impossible. The clarity formation of Ind Group imposed on Labour Brexit policy fading.
author: patrickwintour

text: Biden may find he delayed too long as Bernie Sanders politics tightens grips Democrats 2020 Race.
author: patrickwintour

text: The difficulty is that no-one believes what she says either, including this utterly ludicrous explanation. An honest Secretary of State would accept they have disqualified themselves from this post.
author: patrickwintour

text: These MPs were not there to discuss Polish defence policy. Many views in Polish govt. Hardball on extension of A 50 is in May and sceps interests for different reasons. Some on European Right want Brexit settled. It is Exhibit no 1 in the Macron anti-populist election campaign.
author: patrickwintour

text: Interesting that @OwenPaterson and IDS rocked up at a British-Polish conference in Warsaw Thurs for some diplomacy with Polish ministers. @Anna_M_Anders, overseas dialogue minister, told me she did not favour an extension of Article 50. EU states can veto such an extension.
author: patrickwintour

text: Iran responds. as expected, declaring Mrs Zaghari Ratcliffe is not a dual national, and so UK cannot claim diplomatic protection on her behalf. An impasse that benefits no-one.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hunt statement on Zaghari Ratcliffe
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign Office escalates dispute with Iran over imprisonment of Nazanin Zaghari Ratcliffe by providing her with status of diplomatic protection. Means no longer a consular issue but an issue between two States.
author: patrickwintour

text: Great review by @lionelbarber of The Backchannel, the memoir of William Burns, the near permanent face of US diplomacy. He served 5 Presidents (not this one). Worth hearing Burns interviewed too on "Pod Save America" and when he comes to UK in April.
author: patrickwintour

text: In Warsaw at #BelvedereForum19 UK divisions laid bare as British MPs speaking in Q&A voice support for contrary positions. Pro-Efta, anti-customs union, pro 2nd referendum. UK's Malcolm Rifkind says sign of healthy democracy. Polish speaker urges an end to UK's  permanent crisis.
author: patrickwintour

text: A lot of knowledge is a debilitating thing. Etc
author: patrickwintour

text: At Belvedere Forum @CER_Grant says chances of May deal passing next week 20-25%, Customs Union 25 %, No Deal 10 %, General Election 20 %, and further referendum 20 %. "Essentially we don't know what is going to happen."
author: patrickwintour

text: This suggests @CarolineFlintMP thinks Brexit Britain will compensate for its loss of access to EU markets by introducing higher regulatory standards than EU.  Novel.
author: patrickwintour

text: Mentioned this yesterday. Labour MP accuses the Foreign Secretary of not understanding the British arms control regime that he operates.
author: patrickwintour

text: BREAKING: Another round of meetings between Marshal Haftar and al-Sarraj will begin in Abu Dhabi mid of next week, source confirmed http://www.addresslibya.com/en/archives/42575 … via @LibyanAddressJo
author: patrickwintour

text: Dutch Parliament rapporteurs on Brexit making a point here about the UK's inability to address difficult issues for 3 years.  NB: UK parliament seems to have combined a confrontational political culture, with an aversion to taking decisions. Quite rare.
author: patrickwintour

text: 2015-2022 in a nutshell
author: patrickwintour

text: agree phrase not the best, but the point is that he is giving the impression Ministers leave this to the experts. Thought the experts were history.
author: patrickwintour

text: No.  Interviewer needed to talk about Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK foreign sect. told BBC Radio 4 on Saudi arms sales "The system puts the decision about whether there is likely to be a breach of international humanitarian law at arms length from politicians & so this is not a judgement made by politicians. It made by people at arms length."
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt surely misspoke in saying arms export decisions are made independent of ministers. The FCO head of arms exports policy told select committee in 2016 ministers take decisions in complex cases,"or if we are changing approach in some way". Ministers decide.
author: patrickwintour

text: Too much Brexit coverage is conditional speculation, but if UK is still in European elections this Spring and if the Independent Group win any seat, Emmanuel Macron's platform represents the Group's  ready made natural ally.
author: patrickwintour

text: Margaret Hodge to Corbyn: "either you misled me or your office misled you". And @LordCFalconer not an appropriate person to run the Labour inquiry into anti-semitism.
author: patrickwintour

text: 'I'm not going anywhere, but I'm not running': Hillary Clinton rules out 2020 bid. Virtually the only Democrat to rule themselves out.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt's visit to Yemen did not go down that well with Houthi leadership as described in translation here.
author: patrickwintour

text: Shame if @IanAustinMP and @MikeGapes - now independent - are ejected from foreign affairs select committee as a result of quitting Labour. Perhaps inevitable, & they do not subscribe to Corbyn's "overseas outlook", but the Commons is hardly awash with foreign policy expertise.
author: patrickwintour

text: Global Witness on the UK govt dumping tax transparency vote today. "Anonymously owned companies can act as getaway cars for terrorists, dictators, money launderers and tax evaders. The UK should be fighting to introduce public registers, not thwarting the will of Parliament.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Facing certain defeat, Theresa May does what she does best -finds a road to kick a can down. PS She is visiting Salisbury today to underline the security threat posed by Russia, but wants to keep the UK tax havens often used by Putin's friends under wraps. Not joined up govt.
author: patrickwintour

text: The sports diplomacy, and money,  attached, to the potential expansion of the World Cup 2022 so Qatar are told to share the host role with other Gulf States, is intensifying.
author: patrickwintour

text: This would disappoint @Jesse_Norman
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign Office having kittens about this cross party alliance in the Commons today enforcing public registers of share ownership in overseas territories by end 2020, a legal commitment on which the FCO surreptitiously backtracked by postponing date to 2023.
author: patrickwintour

text: Yes, a good, maybe sufficient, reason, but "His unbiassed opinion, his mature judgment, his enlightened conscience, he ought not to sacrifice to you, to any man, or to any set of men living".
author: patrickwintour

text: Labour Brexit supporting MP finds the government promise that his vote will bring a new economic dawn to Stoke is not all that he hoped. He will have to find another reason to explain why Brexit is good for his town.
author: patrickwintour

text: Asked if he thought Saudis had credible legal process over Khashoggi murder, Hunt said “the jury is out on that, and we have to see what happens, but what everyone needs to be confident of, is that this is something that cannot and will not happen again".
author: patrickwintour

text: Spoke to UK foreign sect Hunt after his return from Yemen “No one on either side wants to return to what it was like six months ago so they want Stockholm to work but they do not trust each other”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Translation. British foreign secretary raised 1) the trial of a state sponsored group that dismembered a dissident writer, 2) the decision this week to try female campaigners that advocated the right to drive and 3) the continued use of laws that treat women as chattels.
author: patrickwintour

text: "I shouldn't really be saying this": John Bercow on Brexit, backbenchers and why nobody dreams of being speaker https://www.prospectmagazine.co.uk/magazine/john-graham-john-bercow-brexit-backbenchers-speaker-profile … via @prospect_uk
author: patrickwintour

text: Something the UK foreign secretary can raise in Riyadh today. Saudi Arabia: detained women's rights activists to be put on trial
author: patrickwintour

text: Everyone has taken what they want from OPCW report into the alleged chemical attack in Douma Syria, including whether a fake by White Helmets and UK intelligence. But this explains well why inspectors judge chlorine found. Next question who dropped the cylinders from helicopters?
author: patrickwintour

text: Excellent move by MPs to end shameful attempt by govt to subvert clear intention of parliament to end tax secrecy. Will provoke row with overseas territories, but Ministers should never have used subterfuge to delay reform and deserve defeat.
author: patrickwintour

text: As @Jeremy_Hunt heads to Saudi and Oman to keep Yemen peace deal alive, Crisis Group fairly  distributes the blame, & sets out the human cost, for the delay in implementing the UN plan. The points of dispute sometimes trivial, but the consequence vast. https://mailchi.mp/crisisgroup.org/crisis-group-yemen-update-2386489 …
author: patrickwintour

text: New UN Syrian special envoy Pedersen gives first report to UNSC hinting at need for a "common forum" for key states to pursue dialogue. Russia calls for patience in preparing a constitutional committee - so far taken 14 months. West repeats refugees will return only if feel safe.
author: patrickwintour

text: think the whole context is about the financial cost to Jordan if you read the piece.
author: patrickwintour

text: Always a pitfall in the Leave campaign. We are slamming the door on one set of migrants, (but in fact leaving it ajar) and then leaving the other door wide open.  Those Labour MPs determined to leave so as to honour their constituents concerns could at least admit as much.
author: patrickwintour

text: Essential For Dead Heads.  The Brilliant Uncertainty of the Grateful Dead’s ‘Dark Star’
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt says he is working round the clock to prevent the Indian-pakistan crisis from deepening, but says from his conversations with both parties he sees no desire to escalate. Both governments are dealing with inflamed public opinion, he warns.
author: patrickwintour

text: Chinese envoy hits back at Williamson's 'gunboat diplomacy'
author: patrickwintour

text: Not just for information, actually.  It is for action.

text: Definitely less complicated than Catan

text: True in the sense that it is a ratification referendum ie a deal has to have been approved by MPs before MPs are asked whether they want to put it to the people. But in circs where MPs cannot agree on a deal, he does not see a referendum as a way of resolving the deadlock.
author: patrickwintour

text: This may be inherent in a ratification referendum, but if MPs reject May deal, and there is deadlock, Corbyn does not regard a referendum as the solution. He says referendum only required if a deal is passed by MPs.
author: patrickwintour

text: Not simples. March 12: MP votes on May's deal. If May deal falls, MPs vote March 13 on no deal exit, & if rejected MPs on March 14 vote on a "short extension of Article 50", something PM stresses cld mean sharper cliff edge in June. So no deal threat extant. Ref vote on March 12?
author: patrickwintour

text: Iran's foreign minister Javad Zarif announces resignation
author: patrickwintour

text: Two combatants in the Yemen civil war - Saudi Arabia and UAE - each pledge $500m at UN conference on Yemen to help the UN reach its $4.3bn humanitarian plan for Yemen. Keynes once said "The government should pay people to dig holes in the ground and then fill them up."
author: patrickwintour

text: This is not going away.
author: patrickwintour

text: In a switch, Iraq to try French ISIS jihadists captured in Syria. Is this French agreement a possible precedent for U.K ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Emily Thornberry, asked whether a party split could have been avoided by revealing the imminent change in Labour Brexit policy last week, says “they knew what our policy was and they knew where we were going. It was clearly sign posted.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Blair making his first remarks since the Independent Group formed.  Not endorsing, but certainly not condemning.
author: patrickwintour

text: Faced by Ind Group, poss. Watson split, and thin case, Corbyn has recalibrated risk by backing ratification ref in MPs vote mid March. If by then no deal blocked by MPs, & ref threat serious, ERG could back reworked May deal. If MPs reject ref, Corbyn tried & Ind Grp lose a cause
author: patrickwintour

text: UN court rejects UK claim to sovereignty over Chagos Islands. All about a shameful episode in British post-war history.
author: patrickwintour

text: The optics of this bode ill. Reminds me of the David Davis launch for the Conservative leadership. Varnished fake oak, nondescript ancestral oil paintings, deep pile carpet. V business class lounge.
author: patrickwintour

text: Does Mr Popper mean writhe on the ground? Or is the Brexit-induced rout of the perchless London Blairite chattering class elite so total that they can no longer afford access to tables and chairs?  Anyway, strong imagery of a doomed resistance.
author: patrickwintour

text: “Hezbollah is continuing to destabilise fragile situation in Middle East – and we are no longer able to distinguish between already banned military wing and the political party,” Home Secretary Sajid Javid said."I have taken the decision to proscribe the group in its entirety.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Saudi Arabia appoints its first female ambassador to US
author: patrickwintour

text: Really recommend these regular updates/guides on Yemen peace process.  Helps to understand how this is such a multidimensional war and how tough the challenge facing special envoy Martin Griffiths.
author: patrickwintour

text: Corbyn has limited time to stop a new tranche of MPs choosing to sit as an separate Labour group.  He has been told to change, requiring him to back a People’s Vote, set up a credibly-run inquiry into anti-semitism, and reorganise his office.  Purify or mollify. His choice.
author: patrickwintour

text: Emily Thornberry has said she will bear the view of her constituency Labour Party in mind in the coming days after it votes to back a 2nd referendum.
author: patrickwintour

text: The Trump backtrack on Syria, as trailed by Graham at the Munich Security Conference and welcomed here, opens question of whether French and British forces will be in an international force to protect Kurds.

text: Weeks to go to Brexit day, and this jumbled incoherent word cloud seems to summarise the overall quality of the British political response.

text: Allies decline request to stay in Syria after U.S. troops withdraw
author: patrickwintour

text: At the end of the joint statement on the backstop is the phrase "President Juncker and Prime Minister May agreed to talk again before the end of the month".  Nothing like "the fierce urgency of now".
author: patrickwintour

text: Figures like @jessphillips giving Corbyn a chance to change, or else they too will leave.  Some Labour MPs feel he is incapable of that change. It is what makes him what he is, for better or worse. But they are trying to transfer responsibility for any wider split onto him.
author: patrickwintour

text: "The key to the [Brexit] deal is getting the Attorney General to change his legal advice."  In politics and war, cabinet legal advice is all...
author: patrickwintour

text: yes.
author: patrickwintour

text: So by Prime Ministers Questions, both party leaders will be looking behind at their benches and see their ranks are diminished. Interesting to see if the defectors choose to sit together.

text: The Conservative defections today will mean the Independent Group has more female MPs than male. Might be a coincidence or say something about political culture.
author: patrickwintour

text: i do think the foreign office is trying to bring peace to Yemen, but it then compartmentalises (terrible word) its support for the UK defence industry.

text: As the Lords issue a report saying U.K. is on wrong side of the law by selling arms to Saudi, the foreign secretary writes to Germany to say Berlin’s embargo on arms sales to Riyadh makes it a bad European.  Chutzpah.

text: Merkel's much praised Munich Security Conference speech signalled Germany is prepared to soften its line on arms export sales. This will have an impact on UK debate. https://p.dw.com/p/3Dakn?maca=en-Twitter-sharing … Germany's Angela Merkel makes arms export pact with France

text: Extraordinary warning to Corbyn from his elected deputy Tom Watson. He puts his nominal boss on notice: you change your way of doing politics or watch more MPs leave. “At times I no longer recognise my own party”, he says.

text: For those who say the SDP failed the Left, a counter argument is that the centre became very competitive in the mid-eighties, hastening Labour's revisionism under Neil Kinnock.  Politics is not all about winning, but changing those to whom you lose.

Four decades ago, but many of the dilemmas facing the radical centre inside Labour including the UK electoral system are v familiar.   https://web.archive.org/web/20160304101858/http://www.totalpolitics.com/speeches/liberal/liberal-politics-general/33323/1979-richard-dimbleby-lecture.thtml …

text: If no deal assessments are published, as seen by Ministers and prepared by civil service, much might change. Some ministers privately say, having seen the Whitehall papers, they would be unable at a subsequent public inquiry to defend having waved no deal through.

text: An international force in North Syria to protect Kurds from Turkey, and help stabilise threat of IS foreign fighters on the loose ?  UK Ministers say not much appetite, but this claims otherwise.

text: Jeremy Hunt ahead of Yemen talks today with UAE and Saudi in Warsaw “We now have a shortening window of opportunity to turn the ceasefire into a durable path to peace".  Talks focus today likely to be economy, shoring up central bank and paying public sector salaries.
author: patrickwintour

text: Keir Starmer now in position of barrister reading out a brief that his client is laughing at. Cannot deny leaders office removed 2nd referendum text in letter to May, & accepts whips did not punish front bench MPs for defying whip to delay Article 50. Look forward to his memoirs.
author: patrickwintour

text: European powers can hardly disguise impatience with today's US anti-Iran Warsaw summit, now refocussed on peace and security in Middle East. Significance may be in Netanyahu presence alongside Gulf leaders.
author: patrickwintour

text: The 40 trade deals due to be ready by March. Just like much else to do with Brexit, they are “significantly off track”,  especially if Foreign Office is the lead negotiator. Via Sun newspaper.  Am told Liam Fox is “in conversation” with the foreign secretary on this.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK chief Brexit negotiator Olly Robbins overheard saying MPs will be given cliff edge choice in March between a reworked PM deal, or very long extension of Article 50.  Govt minister calls it “a second conversation in a noisy bar”. It may however be true.
author: patrickwintour

text: Italian populist government swerves on Venezuela & strongly demands that a new election be held as soon as possible.  Says previous elections lacked legitimacy, but will still not recognise Guaido as interim President.

Implication is Houthis need to do more to grant access.   https://osesgy.unmissions.org/joint-statement-situation-yemen …

text: Boris Johnson “people are looking at us and thinking 'wow they have made this extraordinary choice, to go global, to choose a different future and what does it all mean ?'".  Many will be with him up to the wow, but possibly not much beyond.

text: A small committee of passengers have now identified where the deckchairs on the Titanic are stored, and with the help of the Captain, set up a working party on alternative arrangements for their siting on the upper deck. We are optimistic we can set out our initial thoughts soon.

text: Italy's former Europe minister, and member of the left PD, here criticises Jeremy Corbyn for standing with Russia and China on Venezuela, saying there has been   "silence and no solidarity with the protestors".  No ambiguity on democracy and human rights, he concludes.

text: This by @StewartWood is v important. If MPs want to be sure they retain some control of Brexit process, it's next week or never, he argues. After that, Theresa May will be free to run down the clock, and when it suits her, ask MPs  "My Deal, or No Deal ?"

text: A special place in hell.

text: UAE statement: British citizen Ali Essa Ahmed was not beaten up as he claimed for wearing a Qatar shirt at Asia Games. Say his wounds were self-inflicted. He faces trial for making false statements. Adds FCO wrong to say it is an offence in UAE to show sympathy for Qatar.

text: Some Remain Ministers talk a big game, but then brief "High Noon" is not yet now, implying they will eventually be cast in the hero role in the film played by Gary Cooper.  But "High Noon" is as much about cowardice, and the townsfolk that run from a fight. The clock ticks.

text: Thornberry calls for fresh elections in Venezuela, but breaks with big European powers by saying they were wrong to recognise Guaido. "To suddenly say 'that's it, we had enough,  we recognise X, we do not recognise Y any more'  it's not the way to treat another country".

text: Nearly 2/3rds of Brits claim to know what Plan C is, and a third back it.  Hope the next question was "Can you name one element of Plan C ?" Followed by "how habitually do you lie - every hour, every day or once a week ?"

text: No easy answers etc, but not sure U.K. clocked the cumulative damage being inflicted on its international reputation.  We trade on soft power.

text: A temporary fortnight long majority for a fantasy deal, a majority in principle for no deal and a latent majority for an enforceable extension of Article 50.  Parliament has spoken.

text: May wants to keep no deal threat on table to press Brussels to renegotiate backstop, including withdrawal agreement, Liam Fox says. But Fox also assures MPs they will have a new chance in mid Feb to block no deal. If so, Brussels knows the no deal threat expires in a fortnight.

text: The disjuncture between what chancellor Hammond and business secretary Clark, in leaked transcript, assured major company chiefs last week about a rapid move to get "no deal" off the table, and what May has told MPs today is complete.  May has made them both look fools.

text: In new BBC Brook Lapping doc. Tusk recalls fear in Cameron's eyes for 1st time when negotiating his deal. Tusk had told DC "the truth is that no-one has an appetite for revolution in Europe only because of your stupid referendum. If you try to force us, you will lose everything".

text: Agree on that specific point, but recommend you look at the poll, how constructed etc, the questions etc and and whether support for no deal has gone up or down since ICM last asked this question.    Not sure how valuable it is since 8 options provided.

text: plus the last time ICM asked this question, amongst a smaller array of questions,  the numbers supporting no deal was actually higher !

text: So extend Art 50, prepare for 2nd ref or negotiate a softer Brexit get a combined 57 %.   Seems to be not the most brilliantly constructed poll, and by making sure there is only one "no deal" questions and loads of variations on soft brexit, no deal comes top. Time wasters.

text: Has this much interpreted and contested ICM poll actually been published and does it show any difference from the last time ICM asked this question ? Quite nice to know the specific question etc.

text: A minority cannot be described as taking over parliament if a majority of MPs have to vote for this procedure to go ahead. Conflict is not between minority/majority but whether MPs collectively or executive determine how Brexit is handled in parliament. Unusual, but democratic.

text: The leaders of the two main parties are woefully inadequate and neither has a deliverable policy on Brexit (May’s is in tatters and Corbyn barely has a policy at all), the party system is completely inadequate to the situation, and parliament is spavined. http://chrisgreybrexitblog.blogspot.com/2019/01/a-dangerous-political-void.html …

text: Some EU ambassadors in UK open to Article 50 extension beyond July and the new European Parliament. UK MEPs could be appointed by political parties in proportion to 2014 EP election result. Each pol party could choose method of appointment, including internal elections.

text: PM says ref. was a vote for independent trade deals, and so U.K. must leave customs union. The blue graph shows google searches on CU and the red graph searches for Free Movement. CU searches unlike FM only start well after ref in June 2016. Debate about CU at ref time minimal

text: Attended briefing with Japanese PM spokesman after No 10 press conference.  He made no mention of nuclear deal. Not conclusive, but both sides briefed nuclear deal not part of summit.

text: Enough threads around to fill the V&A costume collection. But these numbers really show price Corbyn paying for Brexit. His assumption must be, come an election, these voters have nowhere else to go, and social/economic issues will dominate.

text: Could the customs union help Theresa May solve Brexit dilemma? Good on the flaws in the current miracle solution to the impasse.

text: Briefing with Iranian ambassador to London @baeidinejad in which he urges Richard Ratcliffe to lower profile of his campaign to release his wife from jail in Tehran. Says politicising and publicising her case "not helpful at all". Says trying to find a humanitarian solution.
author: patrickwintour

text: Macron gives the UK's Brexit both barrels.
author: patrickwintour

text: May insists she understood reasons for her Commons defeat, and will show flexibility, but then gives an evidence-free interpretation of why British people voted for Brexit. Knowledge of the implications of CU at the time of referendum was minimal. Look up google search history.
author: patrickwintour

text: May in knots by repeating her same red lines and insisting "this is what the British people voted for" - "a smooth and orderly exit, protecting our union, giving us control of our borders, laws & money & allowing us to operate an independent trade policy". So no customs union.
author: patrickwintour

text: Alistair Burt, UK foreign office minister, wearing EU cufflinks and giving evidence to Lords on Yemen, accepts ceasefire is under strain but says the problem is not the legal text of ceasefire, but instead the absence of trust.  Extra UN monitors due to be sent from Djibouti.
author: patrickwintour

text: Germany's foreign minister.  Clear what UK does not want, not what it does want. Germany is ready for no deal, but we are hoping for reason
author: patrickwintour

text: Germany's @peteraltmaier "We should give Britain more time to clarify its position".   Becoming more likely that EU will grant an Article 50 extension even if UK's position in flux.
author: patrickwintour

text: Far from “Winter coming,” as Gove claimed, scale of May’s defeat ushers a Spring thaw. Icebergs frozen for months - May’s belief her deal would eventually be endorsed & Corbyn’s reluctance to table no confidence vote - have melted. Some preconditions for rejuvenation are met.
author: patrickwintour

text: Take a bow ⁦⁦@GuardianHeather⁩ and colleagues- this evening’s extraordinary news filed 24 hours earlier.
author: patrickwintour

text: May not defeated, but crushed, by margin of 230 breaking previous record for a government defeat of 166 set in 1924. She will not resign or call election, but ministers admit scale of defeat places onus on her to ask parliament what to do, and not just demand EU tinker with deal.
author: patrickwintour

text: No the aim is to make it a cleaner vote on her deal -  Corbyn gave no hint in his speech when the no confidence motion would be put.  Probably waiting in part for scale of defeat and PM's response.
author: patrickwintour

text: May's date with destiny brought forward 45 mins when three amendments unexpectedly not moved. Newspaper production editors opening the champagne (metaphorically I am sure) as deadlines come forward.
author: patrickwintour

text: Yemen's Stockholm Agreement under severe strain.  5 steps to save the deal - by @peterjsalisbury and International Crisis Group.  Urgently needed new UN resolution on monitoring ceasefire set to be discussed tomorrow at SC.  https://www.crisisgroup.org/middle-east-north-africa/gulf-and-arabian-peninsula/yemen/five-steps-save-yemens-stockholm-agreement … via @crisisgroup
author: patrickwintour

text: At 8.30 tonight on all terrestrial channels.
author: patrickwintour

text: Former German foreign minister Sigmar Gabriel with some surprising advice. #Stopping the clock : #For #Europe’s sake, let’s keep talking to stave off a hard #Brexit
author: patrickwintour

text: Me too...  cough
author: patrickwintour

text: please @LNASpox tweet out link when ready
author: patrickwintour

text: Engaging with Murrison amendment risks parliament no longer voting on what is on offer, but what it would like to be on offer,  the abiding recent sin of UK politics. EU/UK need clarity on a) whether May's deal is demonstrably dead, or not and b) if it is, how she can respond.
author: patrickwintour

text: It was in my case a half hearted reference to the Arab Spring but    as you know the British April “is the cruelest month”. Here as a bonus prize are the best poems on Spring in Britain.
author: patrickwintour

text: Michael Gove, adapting John Snow, says “ If we don’t vote for the deal tonight, winter is coming”.  It’s January, so in truth Spring is coming. The British Spring.
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump Repeatedly Discussed Pulling U.S. From NATO Last Year, Aides Say Amid New Concerns Over Russia.   Trump has a habit of acting on his worst instincts, and no Mattis to deter him.
author: patrickwintour

text: “it is also an offence against democracy for elected politicians to stare disaster in the face and turn away through fear of saying aloud what they know Brexit to be: a mess, a mistake, a wrong turn, a dead end. That is the irreducible core of the thing…”
author: patrickwintour

text: Iranian Ambassador to London responds negatively to intervention by Hunt demanding Zaghari-Ratcliffe given medical assistance in jail. No mention of her hunger strike or Richard Ratcliffe's claim that Iranians pressured her to spy against UK.  Impasse.
author: patrickwintour

text: Kidnapped ministers smuggling out Samzidat messages begging to be rescued.
author: patrickwintour

text: The calm, honesty, compassion and political judgement of Richard Ratcliffe, wife of Nazanin Zagharai-Ratcliffe,  at his one-hour press conference put the British political class in the shade.
author: patrickwintour

text: Richard spoke to wife Nazanin Zaghari Ratcliffe this morning says she was calm and waiting to see if latest promises of improved medical help are realised. “This is not a game”. Says Hunt has been pretty tough rhetorically, but needs to see some tough action.
author: patrickwintour

text: Nazanin Zaghari Ratcliffe was urged by Iranian Revolutionary Guards to spy against Britain, or face potential consequences for her family, husband Richard tells a London press conference. She refused to do so and has now started 3 day hunger strike. Richard will see UK FS today.
author: patrickwintour

text: May's stellar case was the democratic necessity of honouring referendums, & to highlight this point in her speech, she chose a recent referendum in UK - Welsh Assembly - that the Tories had said they were willing to override. So so inept implies a sabotage squad now on the loose.
author: patrickwintour

text: Well worth reading by @Jesse_Norman, agree or not. Speaker's best defence is it would be a choice to support No Deal Brexit if he had continued to let government control business and run down the clock. Acted in unique circs to allow parliament to express its view.
author: patrickwintour

text: A citizens assembly is a group of 100 or so people brought together to try to resolve difficult issues. They have been used in Ireland.  It would make recommendations to parliament. You are right to say the Guardian support for 2nd ref is v circumscribed.
author: patrickwintour

text: Talk of a British coup - in essence executive ceding further control to MPs over issues and laws debated in parliament. V long legitimate historical debate, incl Robin Cook's reforms, and then Wright Committee report here in 2010. A good Brexit outcome. https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm200809/cmselect/cmrefhoc/1117/1117.pdfhttp://www.ucl.ac.uk/political-science/publications/unit-publications/135.pd …
author: patrickwintour

text: Ministers accused of sleight of hand, and defying the will of parliament, by delaying transparency in UK's tax havens. Govt talks big on leading the fighting corruption, but once again the shady people in sunny places are protected.
author: patrickwintour

text: Joint Statement on the Ministerial to Promote a Future of Peace and Security in the Middle East - signs that the US feel they have located a European ally in their campaign against the Iran nuclear deal https://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2019/01/288428.htm#.XDixKK1mPPh.twitter … (from @StateDept)
author: patrickwintour

text: If true, (stress if) implications for British energy are massive. Eyes have been focussed on a Japanese car manufacturers pull-out due to Brexit, but this is in some ways as consequential.  A commercial decision, etc, but must have been discussed by May and Abe Shinto.
author: patrickwintour

text: Where should Britain go post-Brexit? Eight foreign secretaries respond. An excellent, if often dispiriting, thrashing-about on Britain's future role in the world. Interviews by @SebastianEPayne.   https://www.ft.com/content/3d8451c4-13a2-11e9-a581-4ff78404524e … via @financialtimes
author: patrickwintour

text: Big endorsement here of the Corbyn Brexit strategy from ...@johnredwood
author: patrickwintour

text: Hitachi to halt costly nuclear project in Britain as financing iffy：Japanese PM said this issue not discussed with UK PM on Thursday. Odd, given time together and implications.  The Asahi Shimbun：朝日新聞デジタル
author: patrickwintour

text: Theresa May, facing possible redundancy, does what many people do in the situation -  rings a trade union.
author: patrickwintour

text: A flaw in the wall.  Trump in need of reinforcement.
author: patrickwintour

text: Details of deadly Houthi drone strike on Yemen army parade that may derail UN sponsored peace talks. UN Envoy Martin Griffiths told Security Council Wednesday that violence on decline. Houthis say attack is a reprisal. Everything on precipice.
author: patrickwintour

text: Did not take the TUC general secretary long to see that Theresa May accepting an amendment to be nice to workers, and the environment, might possibly not carry much weight in the courts.
author: patrickwintour

text: How this necessarily vague Labour backbench amendment to impose leftist policies on this and future governments - presumably indefinitely -  could ever be enforced, or even interpreted, by the judiciary is a bit of a flaw in this new plan to save Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: Official UN account of what is going wrong and right in Yemen ceasefire, with some blame apportionment. Instructive for those that tend to ignore Houthi misdeeds.
author: patrickwintour

text: Victims of forced marriage repatriated with the help of the foreign office will no longer be required to pay fees, the foreign secretary Jeremy Hunt has told foreign affairs select committee chair @TomTugendhat.  Outstanding loans to be cleared.   Follows a Times story.
author: patrickwintour

text: UN Yemen Envoy Martin Griffiths gives positive take to UN on adherence of parties to deal reached in Stockholm last month. Says big decrease in hostilities since Dec 18. Prisoner swap meeting in Jordan next week. But others say exchange rate down, & Houthi still backsliding.
author: patrickwintour

text: This piece claims migration from Libya to Italy fell due to Salvini's policies. The large drop occurred, and embedded, before the election due to the policies of the previous Interior Minister from PD. Look at IoM stats.  Quite why Spectator wants to big up Salvini, God Knows.
author: patrickwintour

text: Worrying that these pictures of the original arrest of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe are being released now.    She is in dispute with prison authorities over the medical aid given to her.
author: patrickwintour

text: The next step.
author: patrickwintour

text: Lord Patten told foreign affairs select that many academics prefer to cover up Chinese state interference in UK universities. Without wanting govt to advise academia on specific research projects with China, says Whitehall  should take broad view & provide advice, eg on firms.
author: patrickwintour

text: With piquant timing Edvard Munch's The Scream comes to the British Museum in April. It will be shown in "the Anxiety and Separation section of the exhibition, which will also include a drawing, Despair". Norway plus.
author: patrickwintour

text: Fintan O’Toole: British wrong to think revolutions are bloodless https://www.irishtimes.com/opinion/fintan-o-toole-british-wrong-to-think-revolutions-are-bloodless-1.3750211#.XDSDNzkTB3U.twitter … via @IrishTimesOpEd
author: patrickwintour

text: Brexit Secretary Steve Barclay said the intimidation of Anna Soubry illustrates the divisions a 2nd referendum would stir. In saying this, he gave succour to those prepared to use political violence. The best reference politicians should make to these thugs is to the police.
author: patrickwintour

text: In Commons @EmilyThornberry warns Iran that in a critical year in which it will need allies against the US,  its barbaric treatment of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe means it is day by day digging its own diplomatic grave.
author: patrickwintour

text: Populists like to break the rules, and 5 Star movement will neatly distance itself from the violence, but not sure Macron can ever forgive Di Maoi for this act of international solidarity.
author: patrickwintour

text: This man is making loads - good luck to him - to sit with his truck in a disused airport in Manston Kent to convince Michel Barnier that he better give the U.K. a clearer route out of the Northern Ireland backstop, or else. Ever felt the U.K. took a wrong turn somewhere ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Weirdness to some is mainstream to others. They are on the right, but they have an  influence
author: patrickwintour

text: UK is still "2nd most geopolitically capable" nation on earth - more powerful than China  - as measured here by Henry Jackson Society. This pervasive kind of anti-declinism is at heart of Brexiteer's confidence that UK will prosper outside EU, even without any deal.
author: patrickwintour

text: Cui bono ?  This hack is already being descrived by the German left as an assault on social cohesion and democracy.
author: patrickwintour

text: Massive hack of German political class. Hacker and hacker’s purpose unclear.
author: patrickwintour

text: A country by country guide in the LRB on how Brexit is seen in Europe, including "When Belgians watch the Götterdämmerung of ineptocracy that is Brexit, they are baffled but entertained." https://www.lrb.co.uk/v41/n01/on-brexit/what-europeans-talk-about-when-they-talk-about-brexit … via @LRB
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt says President Assad will be around for awhile.   A statement of the obvious, but a British rhetorical step-back from the normal Assad must go. Comes as US policy towards Syria might be described as in flux (one stop short of chaos)
author: patrickwintour

text: Singaporean activist found guilty today of organising illegal protest after holding what he called a "harmless" public discussion in 2016 with Hong Kong democracy campaigner Joshua Wong via Skype. Singapore is part of UK foreign office's well-termed "invisible chain of democracy"
author: patrickwintour

text: certainly it helped to have cheap migrant labour, something of course Theresa May promises Brexit will bring to a halt.
author: patrickwintour

text: Why is the Tory Party so persistently partial to Singapore?   This piece two months ago by the FT's former correspondent is an informed antidote -   "Brexiteers – have you even been to Singapore?" | Jeevan Vasagar
author: patrickwintour

text: So long as so many Labour members supporting Remain think Corbyn is doing a good job overall, and do not oppose Labour Brexit policy, you have to question either the poll, the polled or the need for Corbyn to change his stance. Loyalty used to be the Tories secret weapon.
author: patrickwintour

text: Unfortunate that Romania, taking on the EU Presidency from tomorrow, is so ill-prepared, divided and corrupt that even the EU Commission leadership doubts the country's capacity to oversee the UK's exit from the EU in March.
author: patrickwintour

text: Keeping your enemy ( and your allies) guessing.  The only continuity in US policy towards Syria is that there will be another policy along in a minute.
author: patrickwintour

text: Paddy Ashdown: a lovely tribute to Britain’s irrepressible internationalist by @greenmiranda https://www.ft.com/content/e4fbbbec-062b-11e9-9fe8-acdb36967cfc … via @financialtimes
author: patrickwintour

text: It’s not in Paddy Ashdown’s nature to RIP, but I hope he knows how well he is remembered. Calls from Paddy - frequent & funny - invariably presaged a bold new plan to advance liberalism, not himself. An adventurer & friend-maker with a gift to make most of life & those around him
author: patrickwintour

text: There are few Trump tweets that do not make you shudder. But this is so ungracious, small minded and simply glorifies his ignorance of the American fight against Islamic State. Nothing seems capable of giving him pause for second thoughts, assuming there was a first thought.
author: patrickwintour

text: Europe responds with alarm to US defence secretary's resignation
author: patrickwintour

text: A warning from UK foreign office to the US that reliability matters.  In the Middle East, "if allies are cannot be relied upon, others are sought to take their place".  Unstated. Can UK rely on America ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Houthi leaders claim there is US obstruction of UK's draft UN resolution affirming Yemen peace plan agreed in Sweden.  Says it is part of a strategy to relaunch Saudi-UAE offensive against Houthis. Stakes very high now.
author: patrickwintour

text: I try but it seems an increasingly arcane journalistic past time.
author: patrickwintour

text: Zero UK pol activity around Trump ground pull-out from Syria, now reportedly including end to US air campaign.  Trump did not consult UK, even though UK still active over skies of Syria & regards Daesh as a continuing threat.  Only airspace in which UK interested is over Gatwick.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sick irony that warring parties in Yemen showed maturity, and so made unexpected progress on a ceasefire in Stockholm, but the great powers at UN now unable to agree a resolution endorsing Stockholm.  US determined resolution condemns Iranian arms to Houthis. Russia opposes.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK UN Ambassador addresses Trump claim that Daesh is defeated in Syria. She says advances have been made, but adds "RAF active in last 24 hours in area...much remains to be done and we must not lose sight of threat Daesh continue to pose even when they no longer hold territory"
author: patrickwintour

text: US and UK accuse China of sustained hacking campaign
author: patrickwintour

text: U.K. foreign secretary Jeremy Hunt identifies Chinese Ministry of State Security as behind “one of the most significant and widespread cyber intrusions against the UK and allies uncovered to date, targeting trade secrets and economies around the world.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Big Western intelligence call out underway of Chinese govt guided entity - APT 10 - responsible for world wide theft of Western commercial intellectual property. “It’s tentacles are everywhere” says one UK security official.
author: patrickwintour

text: Middle East Minister Alistair Burt: "Let me be perfectly clear. I would regard a ‘no deal’ outcome as a  serious blow to the U.K., and will do all I can to prevent this."
author: patrickwintour

text: UK responds to Trump’s troop pull out from Syria “Coalition has recaptured the vast majority of Daesh territory ....But much remains to be done and we must not lose sight of the threat they pose. Even without territory, Daesh will remain a threat.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Interesting to know if  @UKagainstDaesh 1) agrees with Trump that Daesh defeated in Syria 2) accepts Turkey can attack coalition's previous allies the Kurds 3) now ends air campaign in Syria 4) was consulted by White House 5) can set out a Syrian strategy.
author: patrickwintour

text: Remarks this week by the US envoy on Syria below made no reference to the imminent US troop pull-out of Syria, but did imply US support for Kurds in face of Turkish threats was time limited.
author: patrickwintour

text: Len McCluskey: a second Brexit referendum risks tearing our society apart
author: patrickwintour

text: I think the point of the Nick Boles tweet is to say he would vote for an election if faced with no deal Brexit.   Other Conservatives feel the same.   Country before party etc
author: patrickwintour

text: Not if she loses a confidence motion. Enough Conservatives in and out of government ready to force an election rather than go with a No Deal Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: Proof that Theresa May is pointing a gun, loaded with £2bn bullet, at her own head. The EU knows she is deep in the locker of empty threats. No Commons majority for no deal.
author: patrickwintour

text: Brief statement in Geneva by Russian foreign minister Lavrov that Syrian constitutional committee, a year in making, will meet early next year. But UN Envoy says extra mile still to go to ensure committee is credible and balanced. Reports Lavrov rejected UN supplied names.
author: patrickwintour

text: This academic is the number 1 expert on Norway's relations with the EU and has written the definitive study.  There is a case for Norway plus, and UK joining EEA, but here he sets out why Norway's political class is so wary of UK joining.
author: patrickwintour

text: "UN Hails Saudi Arabia’s Promotion of Human Rights".  Never sure what purpose served by this kind of nonsense, save presumably self-deception.
author: patrickwintour

text: UN Special Envoy for Yemen Martin Griffiths said ceasefire in Hodeidha is starting to take hold: "So far so good, fingers crossed". UN appointed General will be holding first meeting of joint monitoring committee tomorrow to oversee ceasefire & first phase of troop withdrawals.
author: patrickwintour

text: Just over 2 hours to go....
author: patrickwintour

text: If May thinks she can split Labour, tempting for her not to timetable Corbyn motion of no confidence in her, so force Corbyn to shift to vote of no conf. in her govt, see him lose that confidence vote and make JC confront 2nd ref issue. But this involves uncharacteristic risk.
author: patrickwintour

text: Labour insisting they briefed their threat of no confidence motion in May if she set no date for meaningful vote before they were given advance copy of statement showing she would set a date.  But Attorney General told MPs on Dec 11 meaningful vote before Jan 21.
author: patrickwintour

text: Corbyn's opening remark "I thank the prime minister for advance copy of her statement", was bit of a give-away.  Suggests Corbyn may have known May would announce a date for the meaningful vote before he threatened her with a vote of no confidence, if she did not.
author: patrickwintour

text: How Trump Made War on Angela Merkel and Europe
author: patrickwintour

text: Are you saying he chose Monaco due to the weather .and the competitive conditions, and not for tax reasons?
author: patrickwintour

text: Could it be a future requirement that the British sports personality of the year actually paid tax in Britain?
author: patrickwintour

text: Please thanks
author: patrickwintour

text: Odd Theresa May attacks Tony Blair for insulting the prime minister’s office by going to Brussels to undermine Brexit,  but John Major escapes her censure for making this speech in Ireland last week. No rule ex-PMs must support successors.
author: patrickwintour

text: Just says existing data roaming charges may no longer apply.  Don’t think the analysis represents major academic analysis or competition for your peerless work. More a bit of Brexit reaching a mundane life.
author: patrickwintour

text: Stuff got real. Travel advice for my son’s football tour to Holland post-March 29 just arrived. In event of no deal Brexit, special travel insurance required, data roaming charges go up and new passport rules apply. #Footballsstayinghome.
author: patrickwintour

text: Theresa May not in charge in Brussels, Parliament, Cabinet nor, it now seems, her private office. Very final days if your chief of staff and your deputy plot behind your back. Difficult for No 10 since its denials of previous Sunday Times stories proved false.
author: patrickwintour

text: Absolutely. Open mind not an empty mind.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hunt interviewed on R4 says he believes Houthis are sincere and UN resolution will help both sides in Yemen dive into deep end. MBS support has been essential for Stockholm peace....then back to UK national pastime- discussing Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sir Ivan Rogers former UK envoy to EU is back with more home truths.  Hope someone will publish his collected speeches.  Withering Heights.  https://news.liverpool.ac.uk/2018/12/13/full-speech-sir-ivan-rogers-on-brexit/ …
author: patrickwintour

text: German for. http://min.to  Bundestag "The understandable desire to reverse the Brexit process is something that we all care about deeply, but if you look at current UK polls, you will see that not much has changed since the referendum".
author: patrickwintour

text: tone has changed - says something that could be a positive for the Left if campaign conducted in a certain way.
author: patrickwintour

text: Owen Jones accepts a 2nd referendum is possible when there is no other option left.  Not quite a conversion, but no longer a heresy.
author: patrickwintour

text: Continued Saudi blockade of Qatar having its inevitable impact on Middle East alliances. Two key overseas political speakers at @DohaForum this weekend are foreign ministers from Iran and Turkey.
author: patrickwintour

text: Full texts of the Stockholm agreements between warring parties in Yemen here. More progress than expected month ago.  All may yet collapse, especially if West lets its attention drift.  Good sign that UK @Jeremy_Hunt took time to fly to Stockholm.
author: patrickwintour

text: Saad Hariri says the Saudi govt handled whole Khashoggi matter poorly at first but it is now taking course to justice.  Says Lebanon relationship with Saudi “could not be better” and predicts Saudi investment in his country as soon as it forms a govt.
author: patrickwintour

text: Saad Hariri said “we are in the last 100m of forming a government." Says “pretty sure” it will be done by the end of the year. After seven months only one obstacle remains to formation of government.
author: patrickwintour

text: The morning after - a sense of stasis prevails.  "The sun shone, having no alternative, on the nothing new".   But there is in truth a new mercifully brief proposal in here for how May could still get her Brexit deal through parliament. https://www.prospectmagazine.co.uk/politics/how-theresa-may-could-still-get-her-brexit-deal-through-parliament … via @prospect_uk
author: patrickwintour

text: It has a certain historical resonance to which Salvini refers.
author: patrickwintour

text: Italy's populist Salvini "changes tack on EU in bid for centre ground" as he calls for a new Berlin-Rome axis.
author: patrickwintour

text: Lebanese PM-designate Saad Hariri has today arrived in the UK. He should feel at home in the UK's ungoverned space. Since elections 7 months ago, the first in 10 years, Hariri has been unable to form a govt as he grapples with more than 20 parties vying for 30 cabinet posts.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sir Alan Duncan, FCO minister, insists none of the £2m foreign office cash to the Institute of Statecraft has been used to fund domestic party politics such as criticising Corbyn. But he has asked the Institute to clarify the distinction between its foreign and domestic activity.
author: patrickwintour

text: UN Secretary-General Antonio Gutteres due to attend the final day of talks on Yemen in Sweden tomorrow.   Can the two sides agree on a cessation of hostilities or at minimum a wind-down in and around Hodeida
author: patrickwintour

text: How is the hang-over
author: patrickwintour

text: Parliament denied a vote, the electorate denied a vote and cabinet denied a vote. Conservative Party seems to believe UK's future relationship with Europe is still its private property, confined to 315 MPs, and then 100,000 party members, disproportionately old, wealthy, Southern
author: patrickwintour

text: The point raised by @patmcfaddenmp ? What of the minister's response ?
author: patrickwintour

text: .@YvetteCooperMP tries to smoke out if govt feels required by law, or only by choice, to let MPs vote on Brexit deal by January 21. Brexit minister says full intention is to hold amendable vote before Jan 21, incl if no deal agreed. Risk is at 11th hour May says my deal or chaos.
author: patrickwintour

text: No timetable offered by May for a meaningful vote for MPs save no later than Jan 21.  No timetable offered by Corbyn for a no confidence motion. By contrast, Speaker takes initiative by saying MPs should be given right to vote on govt plans. The Speaker is now the Opposition.
author: patrickwintour

text: actually, he is now saying an unidentified colleague took temporary charge of his phone, and "bollocks" does not reflect his or collective government thinking at this stage. 100 %
author: patrickwintour

text: Europe minister here talking through the options for the government,
author: patrickwintour

text: The government -  a whip  - just has to say to the Speaker at the appropriate moment the vote is not this day.  But my knowledge of parliamentary procedure extends to the fact that there is normally a way to challenge procedure especially if the Speaker wants to play along.
author: patrickwintour

text: Rory Stewart prisons minister "We are going to end up in a completely mad world", as he contemplates the reality there is no Commons majority for anything.
author: patrickwintour

text: Legend.
author: patrickwintour

text: It was ?
author: patrickwintour

text: The UK Prime Minister's opening remarks in Commons debate on Brexit deal "At the start of five days of debate that will set the course our country takes for decades to come ...."
author: patrickwintour

text: 900 days have passed since June 23, 2016 referendum. Theresa May thought the 763 days between 2015 and 2017 elections sufficient to retest the public's view of Tory Party. Many say not comparable since ref. unimplemented, but May at least selects when mandates should be renewed.
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson plan: 1) Demand EU give the UK a deal without a backstop, says this is not a fantasy since "horses change places in the final furlong". 2) Prepare convincingly for No Deal. 3) Threaten to withhold payment of half of £39bn UK exit fee until EU gives UK a trade deal.
author: patrickwintour

text: Assuming Conservatives stay in power, significant part of @AmberRuddHR interview in Times concerns her proposals to reform universal credit including moving from monthly payments, ending welfare cash freeze and direct payments to landlords
author: patrickwintour

text: Sorry for that.
author: patrickwintour

text: You could have watched it on Facebook and I think there is a full text that I can forward if you have an email hope this helps - v interesting speech
author: patrickwintour

text: Corbyn in Lisbon tells European socialists "we have to respect the result of that referendum. It is our job to shape what comes next".  Says No Deal must be avoided at all costs. Says Labour can negotiate a better deal with extra time.  Sees EU as in hands of corporate elite.
author: patrickwintour

text: Olivier Faure 1st secretary of French socialist party at PES conference says polls due to to published tomorrow will show 41% of French are "ready and willing to vote for a yellow jacket party in European elections"  Says the movement is "infectious and will spread across Europe"
author: patrickwintour

text: interviewed in Guardian today, but very well put here.
author: patrickwintour

text: Socialist leader in EP @UdoBullmann warns Macron that people cannot be convinced to go green "if you cannot tell your family how you will be able to make ends meet at end of the month".  Children forced onto their knees in school yards - "this is not our Europe".  #PESinLisbon
author: patrickwintour

text: The geography of this is extraordinary.
author: patrickwintour

text: ‘Macron’s arrogance unites us’ – on the barricades with France’s gilets jaunes
author: patrickwintour

text: Think this is a No.
