author: patrickwintour

text: May offers a role of Parliament in deciding whether to go into backstop or instead extending transition period by up to 2 years. Postpones backstop. She offered the story at start of interview but JH missed it.
author: patrickwintour

text: Norway Plus, currently back in vogue at Westminster thanks to @NickBoles, and general sense of desperation, mercilessly taken apart by @HenryNewman from @OpenEurope.
author: patrickwintour

text: As famine draws near in Yemen, UN Special Envoy for Yemen sets out his plans for talks in Sweden including a prisoner swap, future of Hodeida and a UN resolution.
author: patrickwintour

text: Unite leader warns Labour against backing second EU referendum, and calls for an end to free movement of labour.
author: patrickwintour

text: Lycka till!
author: patrickwintour

text: Fair enough argument even though i think describing a vote in parliament as a trick repeats the language error. PS many ways to honour the manifesto commitment, and the manifesto did not produce an overall Commons majority so TM has no free hand. Best  !
author: patrickwintour

text: They cited GDPR unbelievably and first meeting between Hedges and FCO largely taken up with him giving permission for FCO to consult with his wife.
author: patrickwintour

text: A vote in parliament is the antithesis of a coup, but people that adopt this language, or imply parliament is being subverted by the establishment, need to consider where this thought next takes them.
author: patrickwintour

text: Respect. This is how politics can heal, as well as divide.
author: patrickwintour

text: Grieve and Benn amendments, plus ECJ case, means May, if defeated on vote on Tuesday, starts to lose control of events to MPs. So if govt did try again to push the deal through, this motion would itself be amendable.  Norway and 2nd ref now pushing to the front of pack.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt in exchanges with @EmilyThornberry does not deny UK compromised on UN draft Yemen resolution by removing a reference to a UN inquiry into war crimes in Yemen. Hunt adds UN resolution aimed at cessation of hostilities will only be tabled following talks in Sweden.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hi UK wording is inconsistent with UN resolution,  but have quoted those saying resolution wording says otherwise.
author: patrickwintour

text: Might seem trivial, but first step in peace talks sometimes the hardest.  This was the kind of hurdle that prevented the first negotiations in Yemen since 2016 taking place in Geneva this September. Stockholm is the new venue, starting this week. Famine is still at Yemen's door.
author: patrickwintour

text: Yemen:UN envoy arrives in Yemen to help escort injured Houthi rebel fighters, raising hope of peace talks will start
author: patrickwintour

text: DUP claims Brexit legal advice would expose Theresa May as a ‘liar’
author: patrickwintour

text: Responding to reports that Theresa May will postpone vote next week on Brexit deal, Home Secretary @sajidjavid says "I do not think there is any chance of pulling the vote. This vote is taking place as planned".
author: patrickwintour

text: The Guardian view on parliament’s Brexit debate: “time to choose”.
author: patrickwintour

text: French President Emmanuel Macron told Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman that Europeans will insist on international experts being part of the investigations into a Saudi journalist's murder, an Elysee official said.
author: patrickwintour

text: Not very clear what he has been clear about. But it clear he does wants to co-ordinate the clarity.
author: patrickwintour

text: Theresa May to meet Saudi Crown Prince today with little sign he thinks he is cornered. She can test him on 1)Saudi refusal to tell Turkey where the remains of Khashoggi rest. 2)Saudi opposition to UK sponsored Yemen ceasefire resolution at UN. 3)Saudi view of victory in Yemen.
author: patrickwintour

text: As Canada imposes sanctions on Saudi, around 200 Royal Air Force servicemen and 8 Typhoon jets are now in Saudi Arabia taking part in a ‘pre-planned’ Green Flag exercise to help the Royal Saudi Air Forces maintain combat readiness. Joint exercises continue until December 11.
author: patrickwintour

text: How UK plans for a UN Yemen ceasefire resolution are being blocked.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK's Jeremy Hunt has been considering that UK offer to host the UN climate change conference in 2020, five years after original Paris Declaration. Big sign of UK global engagement post Brexit etc. Could UK instead offer to host 2019 conference now that Brazil has pulled out?
author: patrickwintour

text: Staffan de Mistura UN Syria envoy at Astana meeting "deeply regrets there was no tangible progress in overcoming the ten-month stalemate on the composition of the constitutional committee. Sadly for Syrian people, this been a missed opportunity". His tenure ending with a whimper
author: patrickwintour

text: It’s no compromise with the aristocracy crew during French Revolution
author: patrickwintour

text: Can u help me there ?
author: patrickwintour

text: This leader conference must have lasted a long time.
author: patrickwintour

text: “The thought police would get him just the same. He had committed--would have committed, even if he had never set pen to paper--the essential crime that contained all others in itself. Thoughtcrime, they called it.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Big stuff happening in Congress on Yemen and Saudi.
author: patrickwintour

text: Three days in Tehran.  'We are desperate': economic crisis hits ordinary Iranians
author: patrickwintour

text: The tectonic plates shift. They can shift back.
author: patrickwintour

text: Germany proposes France becomes the perm rep for the EU on the UN Security Council - something that would leave the UK with an even more arduous task justifying its permanent seat alongside US, China, and Russia
author: patrickwintour

text: Philip Hammond sounds like a door to door salesman saying the other guy’s product is better. Bizarre.
author: patrickwintour

text: Cos the press reviews reads out newspaper headlines.
author: patrickwintour

text: Missing in the headline in the Mail today, but in same poll, 48 to 34 support for a referendum.  Asked to choose between PM deal and Remain, voters opt to remain 46 to 37. Her deal is less popular than No Deal, and Remain more popular than No Deal.
author: patrickwintour

text: The mid-term elections are continuing. Pity the reporter running the Liveblog.
author: patrickwintour

text: Just over 30 civil servants have attended a session on how to negotiate a free trade deal,  the foreign affairs sel comm was told. MPs also don’t believe the govt will meet its target of 240 trained trade experts by March. Luckily EU is disabling UK ability to strike such deals.
author: patrickwintour

text: US 'slams the brakes' on UN Yemen ceasefire resolution - CNNPolitics
author: patrickwintour

text: UK foreign office minister Alan Duncan on dealing with Trump.  "It is difficult to wake up of a morning without seeing something on your phone that you were not quite expecting".
author: patrickwintour

text: the gang of one
author: patrickwintour

text: If this, in UAE govt directed newspaper, is the summation of the evidence that the UAE had on Matthew Hedges, it is pretty thin. He seemed to get on with people and ask questions.  https://www.thenational.ae/uae/courts/the-curious-case-of-matthew-hedges-1.796251 … via @TheNationalUAE
author: patrickwintour

text: France and Germany are trying to rescue a planned European payment channel to keep trade flowing with Iran, defying the U.S., diplomats said https://www.wsj.com/articles/france-and-germany-step-in-to-circumvent-iran-sanctions-1543251650 … via @WSJ
author: patrickwintour

text: Worth reading on the self inflicted damage wrought by the UAE -  from a senior UK defence think tanker.
author: patrickwintour

text: They are indeed, but one of the debiliating aspects of referenda is that MPs subsequently feel disempowered from following their conscience.
author: patrickwintour

text: No.  He has a duty to listen to the Nation.
author: patrickwintour

text: May told MPs today they had a "duty" to listen to their constituents before taking their decision in the national interest. Not sure great argument. If MPs have a duty to listen to constituents, the most scientific way of hearing those views is through a ....referendum.
author: patrickwintour

text: Shortening Matthew Hedges march to freedom.  How everyone saved face and what it means for future UK-UAE relations.
author: patrickwintour

text: Have to say @dtejadav campaign was exemplary .  It took degrees of personal courage, and love, to go out there in public to make the case for her husband's release. So easy for such campaigns to go wrong.
author: patrickwintour

text: Great summary of the legacy of Staffan de Mistura, the outgoing UN Special Envoy for Syria the diplomat's diplomat, and whether his efforts to bring about peace ever had a chance.
author: patrickwintour

text: Matthew Hedges pardoned by the UAE as country insists he was an agent of MI6
author: patrickwintour

text: Given the main Opposition party has been dissolved by Bahrain's highest court, the UK Middle East minister might have qualified his endorsement of Bahrain's commitment to the democratic process.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt says he will be speak to UAE foreign minister again today to discuss release of jailed academic Matthew Hedges and says he remains more optimistic about his fate than last week.
author: patrickwintour

text: “The age of the experts is over” declares Labour MP Richard Burgon. In Burgon’s case it never started, an expert replies. Sad that any front rank politician celebrates ignorance.
author: patrickwintour

text: Blair: “The deal is a dodo”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt in his Facebook live reveals he organised a referendum to pedestrianise Farnham in Surrey in his constituency and the move was backed by 51 % to 49 %.   Says progress since referendum in 2014 has been "frustratingly slow". Sounds familiar. Time for a 2nd referendum.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt Facebook Live says if parliament votes down Brexit deal "the UK would be in a constitutional deadlock and there would be a huge amount of worry by many people who just want the government to get on and deliver Brexit".  Says No Deal is "the last thing we want".
author: patrickwintour

text: US media must 'get smarter' to tackle Trump, says Hillary Clinton
author: patrickwintour

text: Lame, to the point of complacent, foreign office response to the foreign affairs select committee report calling for clearer specific FCO Human Rights goals, specially in light of Brexit. https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201719/cmselect/cmfaff/1759/1759.pdf …
author: patrickwintour

text: Part of UAE London ambassador statement opening the way for a pardon for Matthew Hedges the British academic jailed this week for espionage.
author: patrickwintour

text: UAE Ambassador to London reveals that family of Matthew Hedges jailed for life on spying charges has made a request for clemency and "the government is studying the request".  Adds "we have an extremely close partnership with UK".
author: patrickwintour

text: I will ask, or send me your email to mine. guardian tends not to publish one hour transcripts etc.
author: patrickwintour

text: Yes
author: patrickwintour

text: Possible change of tone between UK and the UAE, following a call between UK foreign secretary and his UAE opposite number.  UAE may yet "show clemency" to jailed academic Hedges. UAE National Day by chance falls next Thursday, traditionally a day when UAE grants pardons.
author: patrickwintour

text: In response to the life sentence for Matthew Hedges, a change to Foreign Office travel advice for British citizens traveling to the UAE could be considered, if a stretch. In 2017, 815,000 UK citizens visited Dubai, third largest market behind India and Saudi Arabia.
author: patrickwintour

text: As a British academic prepares for life in a Dubai jail, Emmanuel Macron welcomes UAE's Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed to a summit in France. The 2 countries "support values of tolerance, promote dialogue, interaction & coexistence among peoples, and cultures".
author: patrickwintour

text: The Guardian view on the UAE sentencing of Matthew Hedges: a violation of rights - Recommended reading.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hunt says very serious consequences face Saudi if it does not comply with the UN resolution requiring the opening of humanitarian supplies in Yemen within a fortnight.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hunt says aim of Yemen draft UN resolution is to get both sides to talks in Stockholm on Nov 28. Says resolution due to be voted upon tomorrow is limited since if UK diplomacy goes too fast too early, danger is no one will agree.
author: patrickwintour

text: Great in Tehran at moment but back soon
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt says he is deeply shocked and disappointed by the UAE jailing of academic Matthew Hedges for life for allegedly spying. Says not what he expected from an ally and parter. Tension between UK’s traditional allies in Gulf including Saudi at their worst for some time.
author: patrickwintour

text: Zaghari-Ratcliffe convicted in a competent court - Iranian foreign ministry
author: patrickwintour

text: I think the problems will be bigger than a few extra lorry inspectors, yes.
author: patrickwintour

text: If Boris Johnson is elected Conservative leader, and becomes Prime Minister, he intends to appoint Jacob Rees-Mogg as Chancellor of the Exchequer., it is reported.  UK could be weeks away from @Jacob_Rees_Mogg emergency budget. @johnmcdonnellMP recast as the reassuring option.
author: patrickwintour

text: Dominc Raab says "This is not Dunkirk", before explaining risk of problems at Dover in event of no deal can be reduced by half by increasing the number of lorry inspection cabins from 2 to 10. Simple really.
author: patrickwintour

text: CIA concludes Saudi crown prince ordered Jamal Khashoggi’s assassination.
author: patrickwintour

text: A lot of dictators would take solace from that kind of sentiment. UN rapporteurs go round the world poking their nose in other country’s human rights anti terror laws
author: patrickwintour

text: FCO on Saudi Khashoggi investigation. The beginning of the judicial process must be a step towards holding accountable those responsible....and we expect that the ongoing investigation will proceed in accordance with internationally adopted legal standards. Monitoring closely etc
author: patrickwintour

text: The Times are changing.
author: patrickwintour

text: Others better than I @paulwaugh @JohnRentoul say the May pauses on LBC re free vote merely reflects her surprise that the question was being asked, and she reasserted collective cabinet responsibility. She seemed either way oddly attuned to the question.
author: patrickwintour

text: May on LBC stuttering and pausing when questioned whether she will offer her MPs a free vote. Penny Mordaunt argument for a free vote on the deal clearly in play. May just says “There is cabinet responsibility.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Further evidence from Turkish government to challenge Saudi claim Khashoggi murder was not premeditated.  France and US said Saudi investigation findings were a step in right direction.
author: patrickwintour

text: PM giving the press conference she intended to give precisely 24 hours earlier. Just a couple of things have happened inside her party in the interim, but she hopes she can pull it back in the days ahead. "Am I going to see this through ? Yes." is the intended gritty takeaway.
author: patrickwintour

text: First Tory to resign over UK treatment of Asia Bibi, plus Brexit. A niche double resignation.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt, and peers from international relations select committee, spend one hour together mulling Global Britain. Government in flames, scenery crashing all around them, fire alarms blaring, and they conspire to discuss the merits of the view out the window.
author: patrickwintour

text: Discussing Brexit foreign secretary Hunt says "Government is committed to implementing the will of the people"  Adds "it would be a step backward if friendly countries erected huge trade barriers with each other and we should seek to avoid that".
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt "We are very actively looking at when the most appropriate time to have a UN Security Council Resolution on Yemen". Spoke to Saudi FM this AM and he has agreed a procedure for Houthi negotiators to fly to Stockholm for peace talks.
author: patrickwintour

text: Bad joke Bad day
author: patrickwintour

text: the numbers that will ever look or understand the agreement will always be low.  its all going to be very instinctive, as well as analytical. No solution is good at this point.
author: patrickwintour

text: you can it one of two ways. Option 1 this deal, no deal or remain. Option 2 this deal or remain. If option 1 - the fairest option, in my view - the votes of those that backed option with fewest votes get redistributed.  Danger of Opt 2 is no dealers abstain.
author: patrickwintour

text: No fresh veg is better.   If you have a garden start turning the soil for an early crop of lettuce.
author: patrickwintour

text: You are looking for your first vote  !
author: patrickwintour

text: Overnight YouGov poll for @peoplesvote_uk shows that people split 63% to 37% against the deal  - when “don’t knows are excluded - and that 59% now favour a People’s Vote/ 2nd Ref, rising to 64% if deal is rejected. UK govt insists a 2 ref will only be divisive, and not decisive.
author: patrickwintour

text: Details of findings into Saudi Arabian Prosecutor General investigation into Khashoggi case being set out here.
author: patrickwintour

text: Love these guys. Like a Greek chorus, but with dollars.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sidelined by cabinet office & since inception victim of 5 resignations - Raab, Davis, Baker, Bridges and Anelay.  Has there ever been a more ill-fated Whitehall Department? With withdrawal agreement complete, case for closing down & folding into FCO or trade. PS If Brexit lives.
author: patrickwintour

text: Martin Kettle on the dry, but critical issue of how the meaningful vote on Brexit is conducted. Turns on sequencing of amendments. Procedure Select Committee reports on this tonight. Speaker Bercow will hope report gives him a green light to let parliament take back control.
author: patrickwintour

text: Valid point, but hard to abstain on future of your country ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Et Tu Nicke ?  May’s former closest adviser Nick Timothy wields the knife in Telegraph saying “This is not a compromise - it's a capitulation by our Prime Minister “| via @telegraph
author: patrickwintour

text: Eurasia analysts predicts May set to lose Brexit vote offering two possible scenarios.
author: patrickwintour

text: Proposed future foreign policy/defence co-operation. No access to formal EU CFSP meetings.
author: patrickwintour

text: Explicit repeated references to threat of “People’s Vote” by No 10 is a sign of Theresa May vulnerability - part of effort to dragoon Brexiteers to back her plan. But in process she hands parity of status to PV for first time, alongside her deal and no deal. Calculated risk.
author: patrickwintour

text: Loyalist MPs do themselves few favours by recycling Downing Street cheat sheets. This requires more than a whips line to take.
author: patrickwintour

text: Cabinet held nine meetings in three weeks in 1976 during IMF crisis including a weekend meeting on December 11 and 12.  Sure I saw you in Downing Street at the time.
author: patrickwintour

text: Important endorsement of UN Yemen peace talks by UAE foreign minister @AnwarGargash. Attention turns to UN Security Council briefing in New York this Friday.
author: patrickwintour

text: Think Canute had a feel for the ebbs and tides of democracy.
author: patrickwintour

text: Blair says it would be simpler for progressive centre to re-occupy the established parties. “ If not, the politically homeless are not lacking commitment and conviction, and they will find a way of building a new home”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Blair Populism thrives on the politics of fear always looking for someone or someone to blame. But the fear usually derives from a worry which is real. Necessary to recognise anger is genuine and grievances  as legitimate. Must meet people halfway at least.
author: patrickwintour

text: Blair “the only route to unity is clarity, and the only route to clarity is through the people”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Blair: “this is Brexit in theory but still tied to Europe in reality, thus making a mockery of the reason for leaving. Whatever people voted for,  it was not this !  In the cause of taking back control, we lose the control that we had”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Meanwhile, a former prime minister alone with his legacy.
author: patrickwintour

text: Paradox is that MPs now most opposed to deal are Brexit’s strongest supporters. If UK leaves EU, it will be largely due to votes of MPs that opposed Brexit but feel duty to implement a referendum outcome that its adherents say is not being honoured.
author: patrickwintour

text: Important first sign of business response
author: patrickwintour

text: Very old school.
author: patrickwintour

text: Congratulations to the BBC PM program - a hugely gripping and hectic hour of analysis, speculation, prediction, denunciation, and affirmation in which not a single person speaking pretended they knew anything about the actual contents of the deal.  Ignorance made bliss.
author: patrickwintour

text: I think he means even less sovereignty than the inadequate level of sovereignty than at present...but that does not sound as good.
author: patrickwintour

text: agree there is a bit of revisionism in there. Always like a spot of 1000 years of history
author: patrickwintour

text: Without reading the deal, Boris Johnson "It's vassal state stuff. For the first time in 1000 years, this parliament will not have a say over the laws that govern this country. It is utterly unacceptable and it has a kicker - we will not have protected our precious Union".
author: patrickwintour

text: Discussing plan to open Ambassadorial posts to businessmen, Simon McDonald FCO top civil servant says "unlikely to be deluged by outside applicants". Only 3 posts will be advertised for open competition in 2019 at Head of Mission level with pay same as in-house diplomats.
author: patrickwintour

text: Labour MP Mike Gapes said “given clear inability of new Pakistani government of Imran Khan to stop these mobs from intimidating & killing Christians, is it not time to reassess our relations with Pakistan?" Added "big concerns if religious minorities in Pakistan are not safe.”
author: patrickwintour

text: of course thanks
author: patrickwintour

text: Clear from open session at foreign affairs select that the permanent secretary Simon Mcdonald was concerned by reprisals on UK diplomatic staff in Pakistan if UK granted asylum and is looking for a third country.   Not sure why any of this had to go into private session.
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign affairs select committee goes into private session to quiz foreign office permanent under secretary further as to why the UK is not offering asylum to Asia Bibi.  Clear that foreign office is worried by reprisals at embassy. MPs claim UK govt being dictated to by a mob.
author: patrickwintour

text: the point was to get a UN resolution ready on Yemen peace talks, and press the Saudis to speed up their inquiry into Khashoggi killing.
author: patrickwintour

text:
Discussing Khashoggi death Hunt said "This was a truly appalling murder that shocked the world and I think it has also shocked people in Saudi Arabia" 
He insisted he spoke frankly with his Saudi partners seeking assurances "that this cannot and will not happen again"
author: patrickwintour

text: Hunt says encouraged by "temporary lull" in fighting around Yemen port of Hodeida, and says Saudis have agreed to evacuation of 50 injured Houthis fighters to fly to Oman, subject to conditions on who accompanies them. Issue stymied previous round of talks.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt says given assurances by Saudis that legal proceedings will start very shortly against those charged with killing Jamal Khashoggi, adding accountability for those that undertook killing and gave the order is the first but not only step required.
author: patrickwintour

text: The extraordinary turn-around in the Republican base.  Similar changes in the sociology of politics in Europe.
author: patrickwintour

text: Understand Western intelligence agencies have listened to the Turkish audio tape of the Khashoggi killing, but were not given their own copy.   Hence the French can say the tape is not in their possession.
author: patrickwintour

text: Bit of a set back for the red white and blue Brexit, but surely the food on board will improve.  Can put that alongside the blue passport and the Brext festival, and PM really putting together an offer.
author: patrickwintour

text: Billed by Saudis as special envoy of UK prime minister, Simon McDonald, the permanent secretary at UK foreign office, met Saudi foreign minister in Riyadh today. Despite role in Khashoggi murder, Saudis are on the offensive in Yemen. Has UK any leverage ?  https://www.spa.gov.sa/viewfullstory.php?lang=en&newsid=1840164#1840164 …
author: patrickwintour

text: Important clarification by @BakerLuke of what Macron said about European defence, and relations with the US.
author: patrickwintour

text: Right on cue, Labour leadership takes any momentum out of the Remain movement.  Germany informed by the Leader of the Opposition that Brexit cannot be stopped.
author: patrickwintour

text: Why is Turner and not Constable regarded as more important to English landscape painting.   Seems subjective, and possibly wrong.
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson in Washington Post very blunt that Khashoggi killing sanctioned at highest levels of Saudi regime and expresses fears killers are about to get away with it, something that will benefit Iran.
author: patrickwintour

text:
The essence of populism 
The ‘true people’ are locked into a conflict with outsiders.  Nothing should constrain the will of the people.   Great analysis.
author: patrickwintour

text: A valiant effort written by one of the now handful of people left on this planet capable of explaining the importance of the excellent story by @SamCoatesTimes on May’s letter to the DUP on the backstop to the backstop. An issue as impenetrable as it is insoluble.
author: patrickwintour

text: Think this is partly right, but the aim is to get a resolution not a statement by next Friday.
author: patrickwintour

text: Pompeo "This is a fundamental difference in the humanitarian nature of these two nations. Iran causes death and destruction inside Yemen and does nothing to prevent the starvation, and the Saudis provide millions and millions of dollars to mitigate this risk and this harm".
author: patrickwintour

text: Looking forward to the acceptance speech...
author: patrickwintour

text: If like me you were not sure how high the water has to go before it is definitely classified as a wave, this helps.
author: patrickwintour

text: Do
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump: The Saudis "don't know how to use" U.S. bombs in Yemen. Describes the country as “the worst place on earth”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Few heard of Banks per se but millions read his propaganda, so it matters from where it was funded and whether in compliance with law.  PS May's promise on Brexit's form was made to Tory conference, and now looks as if she thinks price too high.
author: patrickwintour

text: Perspective | Defensive, caravan-fixated and Trump-obsessed, the media blow it again. Just not as badly.
author: patrickwintour

text: Pressed 13 times by ⁦@AndrewMarr9⁩ to identify the company that generated cash for his Brexit donation, Banks said it came from insurance profits generated by UK based Rock Services. As Marr pointed out, he told Culture select committee (below) something different. Why ?
author: patrickwintour

text: If true, stress if, very hard for West to say waiting for outcome of Saudi inquiry. into Khashoggi murder.   There is no none, just a cover-up.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK expresses concern at behaviour of another of its Gulf allies of choice. Bahrain High Court of Appeal today quashed acquittal of Sheikh Ali Salman & sentenced him to life, accusing him of collaborating with Qatar.  Bahrain has elections this month. Opposition party is banned.
author: patrickwintour

text: Respectable view, and not sure how People's Vote/2nd Ref campaign can get Labour MPs, such as @JennyChapman, to change their mind in time for meaningful vote etc.  A poll of her constituents in which she is asked to help design the questions ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Mark Sedwill, the new Cabinet Secretary, reflecting on death of Sir Jeremy Heywood: "We will miss him more than we can say, and will be the poorer without his advice, leadership and extraordinary insight."  So many politicians relied on him, and so many benefitted from doing so.
author: patrickwintour

text: Texas early voting tracker: record numbers for a mid-term.  People in Texas either changing the way they vote or v motivated to vote.
author: patrickwintour

text: Writing in Washington Post, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan: "We know that the order to kill Khashoggi came from the highest levels of the Saudi government".
author: patrickwintour

text: David Miliband welcomed US call for ceasefire in Yemen as potentially most significant breakthrough in civil war. Sounding less optimistic now.   Notable silence so far on Saudi push on Hodeida from France, UK and US.
author: patrickwintour

text: Coming to a Presidency near you soon...
author: patrickwintour

text: The claim that Theresa May may have blocked an intelligence services inquiry into the funding of Leave referendum campaign was first made by Tom Watson at Labour conference - see below. Daily Mail may be repeating an as yet not hugely sourced assertion.
author: patrickwintour

text: David Cameron in S. Africa "We have to ask if the 'strong man' leadership style of leaders who believe they alone have all the answers, is what we need now.  You can take difficult decisions and still win the votes. It is about being a good communicator and creating alliances".
author: patrickwintour

text: Not sure this tweet is any longer fully operative.
author: patrickwintour

text:
Independent Arab media faces uphill battle via @FT
U.K. foreign secretary ⁦@Jeremy_Hunt⁩ wants to protect democracy & will host a conference on media freedom soon. This, on the impaired state of Arab media, shows how he is onto something important.
author: patrickwintour

text: If you are trading in the currency markets today, this might help.
author: patrickwintour

text: The vase is no more and apologies for taking your imagination into such new territory
author: patrickwintour

text: Now in the bit of foreign affairs select committee evidence session where a large number of countries are mentioned, and the foreign secretary says they are very important countries, and we need to engage with them. Everyone nods sagely.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hunt says he is strongly in favour of a cessation of hostilities in Yemen as proposed by the US, as it might open up a humanitarian corridor.  He claims Middle East Minister Alistair Burt on Tuesday opposed a ceasefire, and not a cessation of hostilities.
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson says his visit to Riyadh 19-21 September cost £14,000 and was paid by Saudi Arabia.  The visit was to meet regional figures "to promote education for women and girls."
author: patrickwintour

text: Khashoggi murder may be tipping point in Yemen's agony
author: patrickwintour

text: Businessmen to be British ambassadors, says Prime Minister David Cameron in 2010. (Fear I was at this briefing).
author: patrickwintour

text: David Miliband former foreign secretary asks if U.K. will now join US in calling for cessation of hostilities in Yemen after opposing as recently as yesterday. Also asks if U.K. will now support a UN resolution on Yemen and whether UK was blindsided by the US change of policy.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hours after the UK Middle East minister tells MPs that calling for a ceasefire in Yemen is pointless, the Trump administration unveils a blueprint for ceasefire and peace talks.
author: patrickwintour

text: Alistair Burt says he is the only minister dealing with both the humanitarian crisis in Yemen, and the political negotiations. He tells the international development select committee  "Do you know what it is like? It is dreadful".
author: patrickwintour

text: ME Minister Alistair Burt, unusually short tempered, says repeatedly there is no military end to Yemen conflict, but says denial of UK military support to Saudi will not end the conflict.  Says "not illegitimate" to believe Khashoggi case speaks to character of Riyadh regime
author: patrickwintour

text: ME Minister Alistair Burt at international development select committee says UK not party to the conflict in Yemen.  Lloyd Russell-Mole challenges pointing out UK supplies arms, trains Saudi pilots, works in Riyadh military control centre and plots military strategy with Saudi.
author: patrickwintour

text: Alastair Burt the middle east minister blames Houthis for Yemen peace talks not taking place in Geneva.  He rejects new UN SC resolution calling for a ceasefire since it is likely to be rejected and implies this is the opinion of the UN Special Envoy.
author: patrickwintour

text: Saudis demanded good publicity over Yemen aid, leaked UN document shows
author: patrickwintour

text: Shadow foreign secretary Emily Thornberry presses Jeremy Hunt to give closed doors evidence to the Intelligence and Security Committee on whether MI6 had knowledge that Saudi intended to abduct Khashoggi. Hunt told MPs he personally had no prior knowledge of any Saudi plan.
author: patrickwintour

text: Indeed shame that to be on side of working poor is now seen as left leaning.  Great part of the Tory tradition.

text: Parenthetic descriptions can be helpful. Unknowable whether was the last budget before Brexit - last budget before the deadline to leave etc. RF is high quality charity chaired by David Willietts on side of working poor.  Today struggles to broaden its Deal/No deal frame.

text: Indeed.
author: patrickwintour

text: BBC currently keen to help frame our thinking.  The Resolution Foundation is "a left leaning group". The "People's Vote" is the "so-called People's Vote" and the Budget on Monday was "the last Budget before Brexit".

text: Do not understand churnalism point. Original tweet abt how party leadership keen to show why they had better things to do than go on “People’s Vote march” .  Did not mean other events were not per se valid, but about their priorities. Most polls show Labour supporters back “PV”.

Worth ploughing through. http://data.parliament.uk/writtenevidence/committeeevidence.svc/evidencedocument/procedure-committee/motions-under-section-131-of-the-european-union-withdrawal-act-2018/written/91948.html …

text: George Osborne's concluding remarks in 2015 Budget speech "This is the  Budget of an economy taking another big step from austerity to prosperity."  Three years on, the steps keep coming.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK used to a major player in Syria, far more than Germany, but gradually being frozen out due to links with wayward US, antagonism from Russia,  and Russian desire to get hold of EU reconstruction money.  In practice summit changed little, but a sign of the times.
author: patrickwintour

text: Notes from a Shed.
author: patrickwintour

text: ”Trump is a masterful demagogue of the entertainment age. His instruments are resentment, sarcasm, unbounded insult, casual mendacity, and the swaggering assertion of dominance.”  And his approval ratings are rising.
author: patrickwintour

text: Global Britain (part 94). Russian President, Turkish President, French President  & German Chancellor, along with UN Syrian Envoy, meet in Istanbul Sat to discuss ending Syrian civil war.  Uninvited Theresa May will be absent -  giving her time to solve Tory European civil war.
author: patrickwintour

text: Macron condemns calls for end to arms sales to Saudi as demagoguery.   He asks "What's the link between arms sales and Mr Khashoggi's murder? I understand the connection with what's happening in Yemen, but there is no link with Mister Khashoggi".
author: patrickwintour

text: Token male chair too
author: patrickwintour

text: Read out of UKPM call to Saudi on Khashoggi still says Saudi explanation lacks credibility
author: patrickwintour

text: This assessment by the former head of No 10 Delivery Unit captures the true influence of Jeremy Heywood on British government for two decades. That four Prime Ministers - with different politics - found him a pillar is an extraordinary tribute.
author: patrickwintour

text: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez: “The British spend 24 hours a day thinking about Brexit, and the Europeans think about it for four minutes every trimester.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Asked about Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s possible involvement, Mr. Trump said: “Well, the prince is running things over there more so at this stage. He’s running things and so if anybody were going to be, it would be him.” @WSJ
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt in Commons yest. "there is a question as to whether we need to engage in a wider campaign to highlight the issue of media freedom, and that is something that we are considering at the moment". FCO launched a £1m press freedom fund in Nov 2017.
author: patrickwintour

text: German foreign minister says Germany now reviewing already approved arms exports to Saudi.  "As long as the questions are not convincingly answered, there is no basis for arms exports to Saudi Arabia".
author: patrickwintour

text: Presume Erdogan knows more than he revealed today, and capitals know he knows more.  Known Knowns increase his bargaining power.  Striking that he said he believed King Salman was sincere, but did not say same of Crown Prince.
author: patrickwintour

text: Erdogan calls on Saudi Arabia to hand gang responsible for Khashoggi violent murder to be tried in Istanbul. Asks Riyadh to identify "the local collaborator" that it alleges dumped his body. Adds no-one believes a small group planned killing. Who sent gang to Istanbul, he asks.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hunt says "highly unlikely" that foreign office will allow other British officials to attend Saudi investment conference in Riyadh. Decision to be made shortly.   Trade Secretary already not going. At present UK Ambassador to Saudi attending, plus UK Middle East Trade Envoy.
author: patrickwintour

text: hope relevant in judging the degree to which Saudi support may be sliding away in Commons at present.
author: patrickwintour

text: Crispin Blunt, ex foreign affairs sel comm chairman, says Saudi "crocodile tears  to Khashoggi's son - under a travel ban and in effect a hostage for his father's  opinions - is particularly stomach turning". Says has no confidence reform will occur without change in Saudi govt.
author: patrickwintour

text: Nicholas Soames, a friend of Saudi for 40 years, says the Saudi "explanation on this matter is completely implausible and there can be no doubt that the order for this terrible crime came from the very top".
author: patrickwintour

text: Chair of the UK foreign affairs select committee @TomTugendhat says Saudi Arabia has gone from a consultative monarchy to a uni-polar autocracy.  Hunt agrees there has been a pattern of deterioration, and also some conflicting signals.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt "Claim that Khashoggi died in a fight does not amount to a credible explanation". Asks where is body, why silence for so long, who authorised dispatch of 15 officials to Turkey, why Riyadh govt took 17 days to disclose death, why Turks were barred from consulate.
author: patrickwintour

text: Are you also sure you correct that people on the Corbynite Left were not invited to speak ?
author: patrickwintour

text: does it not show that 77 % have a very strong or fairly strong Brexit identity.  So referendum has divided the country in a new way?
author: patrickwintour

text: Lolwah R M Al-Khater, Spokesperson of Qatar Ministry of Foreign Affairs sees Khashoggi murder as "a wake-up call for the entire region. We would like to see a transparent investigation. We have faith in the legal system in Turkey". Qatar subject to Saudi embargo for 16 months.
author: patrickwintour

text: Dr Abdullah Baabood, ex-Director Gulf Studies Centre Qatar Univ. "We are scared. If it could happen to someone like Khashoggi, it could happen to any of us. This is not just one isolated case... We should be able to speak without fearing for our lives."
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson in his Telegraph column has a coruscating attack on Saudi Arabia over the Khashoggi affair, including this passage on the war in Yemen. He did not, I think, speak as plainly in govt.
author: patrickwintour

text: Saudi foreign minister Al-Jubeir says Saudi does not know where Khashoggi body is located, but trying to find. Describes the killing as an aberration and insists the Crown Prince knew nothing of the operation in advance. Says huge and grave mistake. First Saudi Minister to speak.
author: patrickwintour

text: Turkish President Erdogan making statement on Tuesday on what happened to Jamal Khashoggi. The issues 1) The location and state of body.  2)  An "interview" that went wrong or planned assassination ? 3) Who ordered operation?  4) Who ordered cover-up ?  5) How to respond ?

text: Significant that Crown Prince will lead modernisation.

text: The Saudi explanation that  Khashoggi died due to a quarrel and a fist fight in the consulate does not explain the use of a bone saw, or the location of the body. Impression given is of a hot headed discussion spiralling out of control, as opposed to premeditated murder.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sir John Sawers ex-head of M16 says complete fiction to pretend rogue elements in Saudi court responsible for Khashoggi killing. "I do not think he would have done this unless he had not thought he had licence from the US administration frankly to behave as he wished to do so."

text: UK Trade Minister Liam Fox boycotting Riyadh investment conference, but Alistair Burt Foreign Office Minister in written answer to Plaid yesterday says "Officials from our embassies in the region will represent the UK, including Her Majesty's Ambassador to Saudi Arabia".

text: Trump chooses now of all times to praise a Congressman for an assault on a reporter.  Little wonder authoritarian leaders feel they have a friend in the White House.

text: Hunt says will be consequences for UK Saudi relationship if Khashoggi stories true, but says relationship is strategic. "If the stories turn out to be true, part of our reaction will depend on the Saudi reaction and whether they are taking it seriously". Unspecific on arms sales.

text: Balanced piece on the future path of reform including legal reform inside Saudi Arabia in wake of Khashoggi killing.

text: EU has more pressing priorities than Brexit & suicide for Europe to accept Chequers deal.  French finance minister | Article [AMP] | Reuters

text: None but if you are called unhinged by Zuzu Petals you have to take notice
author: patrickwintour

text:
Trump at the UN. 
Good places: India, Saudi Arabia and Poland.
Not Good places: Iran, friends of Iran, Nicaragua, Germany, China, OPEC countries, Syria, countries that don't respect America.  
Places not spoken about: Russia.
author: patrickwintour

text:
Trump at the UN: "America is governed by Americans. We reject the ideology of globalism and embrace the doctrine of patriotism around the world". 
Followed by veiled warning to Russia "We reject the interference of foreign nations in our own hemisphere and in our own affairs".
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump a New Yorker is late to the UN General Assembly missing his speaking slot. The leaders all the way from Brazil and Ecuador manage to get there on time.  Make America Late Again.
author: patrickwintour

text: Blue Labour in tooth and claw.
author: patrickwintour

text: This is the single biggest idea Europe, including the UK, has to protect European businesses in Iran, and so save the Iran nuclear deal collapsing under the weight of US sanctions.  Many sceptical it will work. But Tehran may feel this is enough at this stage.
author: patrickwintour

text: Chilling new findings from US State Dept survey of 1,024 Rohingya refugees in Cox’s Bazar District. 3/4s saw members of army kill someone; One fifth saw mass casualties with more than 100 victims; 40 % saw rape by security services & 18 % saw mass rape.
author: patrickwintour

text: Joint UK French statement on Myanmar "Given the severity of the findings of the UN Fact-Finding Mission, ongoing international efforts are needed to pursue accountability alongside the work of the domestic Committee of Inquiry, which has yet to produce any tangible results."
author: patrickwintour

text: China starts to assert its world view at UN as influence grows.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK foreign secretary Jeremy Hunt hosting lunchtime meeting today in New York with fellow foreign ministers to see if he can gather a consensus to impose sanctions against Myanmar army chief, and hold him and his fellow officers to account for genocide.
author: patrickwintour

text: I have listened to the shadow chancellor on BBC Today explaining what the leadership took from the composite. I think there is a logical flaw in the position that I tried to explain.
author: patrickwintour

text: Her Chequers  offer is still subject to negotiation, but Labour does not think her proposal as it stands meets its six tests. Personally do not see how those tests can be met by anything but UK staying in EU or EEA , both ruled out by her.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sorry this is just me listening to what I understood the Shadow Chancellor said, and trying to show a flaw in the argument.  I am not reporting on conference.  We have an excellent live blog, plus a fair minded team reporting in Liverpool.
author: patrickwintour

text: I am going on what I hear the Shadow Chancellor said nothing else
author: patrickwintour

text:
New Labour policy.  
Labour MPs will vote down May deal, cos it fails six tests, push for GE, fail to get one, and then campaign for a public vote in which the choice is solely between the May deal that Labour has already rejected and no deal/Armageddon. 
What an offer.
author: patrickwintour

text: Union link a strength but Lab now a mass party in which unions still have 50 pc of vote at conf. So party still swayed by 3 unions operating off mandates in which circa 10 pc of their pol levy payers vote. In a way they are Labour’s very own deep state. “Vet that, comrades”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Union votes, & compositing, may protect Corbyn on 2nd ref, but this is an excellent podcast from the pro-Corbyn, pro-Remain @Another_Europe on how this summer it won a battle of ideas in Labour about Europe, and organised the current revolt. https://audioboom.com/posts/7014483-labour-conference-2018-will-members-take-back-control?utm_campaign=embed&utm_content=retweet&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter … via @Audioboom
author: patrickwintour

text: Dawn Butler shadow minister for women and equalities.
author: patrickwintour

text: Myanmar Commander-in-Chief Senior-General Min Aung Hlain deliberately excluded from EU sanctions to keep lines open. He refused to meet UK Jeremy Hunt this week at last minute, and has been found by U.N. as culpable for genocide. Expect Hunt to press for him to be sanctioned.
author: patrickwintour

text: “But it was a fantasy”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Chequers deal has not been in existence for six months let alone six years.
author: patrickwintour

text: well worth reading the whole of the Macrcon remarks on Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: think you may have over-interpreted my views.
author: patrickwintour

text: Macron warned May in advance that he planned to persuade his EU colleagues to go public about the scale of the differences between the EU and the UK. He wanted to force the pace. Merkel was nervous but agreed.
author: patrickwintour

text: At least 10 embassies/high commissions open this weekend as part of @openhouselondon including the American embassy (way better inside than its off-location).  But recommend the Hungarian embassy in Belgravia.  A restored Georgian jewel. Guardian readers welcome.
author: patrickwintour

text: Rise of populism in Europe hardens Macron against May's Brexit plans
author: patrickwintour

text: It was a friendly acknowledgement to someone I know. JC is not the ultimate Brexiteer.  I do not think, for reasons the Guardian has explored well this week, the Labour leadership has chosen to be in same place as its members. We will know more where JC stands at Lab conference.
author: patrickwintour

text: Touché, as we say in Europe.
author: patrickwintour

text: This is the fateful article in @welt this week by Theresa May that apparently persuaded EU leaders they had to use the Salzburg summit to bury her illusions about the deal available to the U.K.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sound of Music summit in Salzburg now closer to West Side Story. Macron is going for the jugular.  He has his own political future also at stake in the European elections. UK diplomatic outreach so far netted Orban.
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign Secretary @Jeremy_Hunt  answers questions directly put to him on twitter about his visit to Myanmar.  Says military impunity must be brought to an end. ICC referral difficult. Raised issue of jailing Reuters journalists. Have to understand difficulty of  Suu Kyi position.
author: patrickwintour

text: Pompeo backed continuing support for Saudi war in Yemen over objections of staff experts after being warned that cutoff could jeopardize $2 billion in weapons sales to America’s Gulf allies https://www.wsj.com/articles/top-u-s-diplomat-backed-continuing-support-for-saudi-war-in-yemen-over-objections-of-staff-1537441200 … via @WSJ
author: patrickwintour

text: A big denial on potentially damaging story that UK intends to lower food standards to secure a trade deal with the US.
author: patrickwintour

text: lots of business connections and gas pipelines.
author: patrickwintour

text: Malta's Muscat says the near-unanimous view of EU leaders is that UK should have a vote on the final Brexit deal. A win for Remain's parallel diplomacy op, about which I wrote. Blair endorsed Muscat in 2017 Malta election and is a friend. The aim is to show EU can help UK stay.
author: patrickwintour

text: No the worst
author: patrickwintour

text: On reports that EU leaders want the UK vote on terms of a Brexit deal,  BBC pol edit explains "It almost could not be more an EU response. The EU has form on this in a sense. If the leader's club does not like the result, well, get the public to vote again until they do."
author: patrickwintour

text: God knows /  all bar five will do what the whip says ?
author: patrickwintour

text: can think of Bebb, Grieve, Soubry, Greening, Lee and Allen.  Some have conditions like it has to be the last resort in event of deadlock in parliament.
author: patrickwintour

text: The usual quotient of time wasters and cynics answering @jeremy_hunt and his request for questions on Burma, but as a way to engage, worth seeing if it works.
author: patrickwintour

text: From the very good piece on Labour and a referendum by ⁦@GuardianHeather⁩. Revealing how wholly opposed to a 2nd referendum/People’s Vote the “Corbyn strategists” are.
author: patrickwintour

text: At UNSC Russia tells West & UN Special Envoy not to interfere by trying to fix a date to agree composition of a constitutional committee for Syria, says this is the preserve of Turkey, Iran and Russia. Impasse over committee for months. Russia will not let West back into Syria
author: patrickwintour

text: it's all Japanese to the foreign secretary.   I think he came out for a  People's Vote.
author: patrickwintour

text: Israel blames incompetent Syrian air defence for the downing of a Russian plane and unusually gives intelligence on the targets it was hitting in Syria
author: patrickwintour

text: EPP head Manfred Weber in London today to see PM joins the kickback against a vague political declaration. “I hear it can be uncertain or unclear . . . I don’t like this. People must know what Brexit is,” he said. https://www.irishtimes.com/news/politics/post-brexit-trade-checks-must-not-be-on-border-epp-chief- …
author: patrickwintour

text: France denies Russian claim it launched missiles towards Latakia Syria from frigate Auvergne deployed in Mediterranean. Israel jets involved, but US says Syrian defence fire downed Russian reconnaissance plane carrying 14 Russian soldiers. Fog of last night's war not yet lifted.
author: patrickwintour

text: Syrian TV reports suspected Israeli strikes on Syrian state company.
author: patrickwintour

text: Andrew Adonis at Chatham House admits he is "vey nervous" of the divisions of a further referendum, but says "the consequences of not doing it would be even greater". Adds it will be "a very close run thing" to win the vote for a referendum in parliament.
author: patrickwintour

text: The same figure for our vast on line readership is around 75 %
author: patrickwintour

text: They need to start reading them !
author: patrickwintour

text: Research conducted by YouGov on behalf of Peoples Vote show 84 % of Guardian readers would back Remain if a referendum today. So would nearly half the Telegraph readership.
author: patrickwintour

text: Putin alongside Erdogan in Sochi says serious progress made.  Joint plan to launch by 15 October a 15-20 km demilitarised buffer zone from which Erdogan says radical elements will be excluded.
author: patrickwintour

text: Pictures of Life underground in Idlib, Northern Syria.
author: patrickwintour

text: Interesting meeting in London with Orban spokesman @zoltanspox.  Insists Orban's party wants to stay in center-right EPP despite last week's vote, Wants to convert EPP to a true anti-migration party. Others see a different game plan.  @EURACTIV
author: patrickwintour

text: Johnson finds new Brexit metaphor. As usual no real solution.
author: patrickwintour

text: Think the Lib Dems are half way through their conference. Parliament is not sitting to allow this to happen.
author: patrickwintour

text: Reminder:  “Leaked WhatsApps Show Downing Street Told Tory MEPs To Distance Themselves From Viktor Orban”. https://www.buzzfeed.com/alexwickham/leaked-whatsapps-show-downing-street-told-tory-meps-to?utm_source=dynamic&utm_campaign=bfsharetwitter … via @alexwickham
author: patrickwintour

text: Clegg understands EU and speaks to decision makers. Says Barnier focus is on withdrawal agreement & content with vacuous if “solemn declaration” on future relations between UK and EU that leaves most to be negotiated after Brexit in March.
author: patrickwintour

text: Conservative MP @RichardBenkonMP asks why Baltic states believe they can implement Magnitsky sanction laws unilaterally,  but the UK says it needs EU wide approval, or Brexit, before doing so. Perhaps @sajidjavid could explain.
author: patrickwintour

text: This from Constitution Unit explains well how parliamentary procedure may provide MPs more than one chance to vote on a 2nd referendum, and thwart govt if it shapes choice as May's deal or no deal.  For politics junkies only.   https://constitution-unit.com/2018/09/07/how-could-a-second-brexit-referendum-be-triggered/ … via @ConUnit_UCL
author: patrickwintour

text: Reports: Two Russians arrested this Spring in Holland suspected of planning to hack into an OPCW certified lab in Switzerland at heart of recent tests for CW use in Syria. Mysterious.
author: patrickwintour

text: Never implied I watched the program. The only GMB in my life is affiliated to the Labour Party.
author: patrickwintour

text: Tories deny registration to Russian diplomats for their conference
author: patrickwintour

text: Small example of how some European leaders regard Russia very differently to U.K. Salvini interview with Russia Today this week.
author: patrickwintour

text: Not sure the fitness training is working for him.
author: patrickwintour

text: Skripal investigation takes surprise new turn. Never fully trusted that ⁦⁦@tnewtondunn⁩
author: patrickwintour

text: Nathalie Loiseau French Europe minister on a blindfold Brexit. "There is a need for clarity on the balance between rights and responsibilities in the future relations between UK & EU. It would be to the benefit of none to remain vague on what is going to be our future relations".
author: patrickwintour

text: A point by point examination of the more unusual aspects of the Skripal suspects' bizarre day trips to Salisbury.  Enough holes in there to fill the Albert Hall.
author: patrickwintour

text: They were very taken by the church door handle.
author: patrickwintour

text: Big boost for UK tourist industry
author: patrickwintour

text: Probably just big fans of the Pevsner Guides to English ecclesiastical architecture.
author: patrickwintour

text: Aung San Suu Kyi says two jailed Reuters journalists can appeal their seven-year sentence.  Adds judgement "had nothing to do with freedom of expression at all, it had to do with an Official Secrets Act."
author: patrickwintour

text: Putin says Russian state knows the two men that Britain named as suspects in Skripal poisoning, says they do not work for ministry and calls on them to contact the media and "tell about themselves".
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Corbyn’s Aide Working In Parliament Without Required Security Clearance via Huffington Post
author: patrickwintour

text: Appeal from @TomTugendhat FAC chair urging his friends - Emirati & Saudi - to "reform the way you act in Yemen .. You are beginning to lose the US Senate and the people of this country"  Says Emiratis simply not equipped to take on civilian government of Hodeida if port captured.
author: patrickwintour

text: Calm forensic account by @hammersmithandy of the secrecy & flaws in the human rights assistance given by foreign office to Bahrain. Countered by Tory MP Bob Stewart says Bahrain govt has only banned parties that advocate violence & cares about human rights.
author: patrickwintour

text: Very good on Parliament’s true Brexit options by @TomHRaines - if may underplay 2nd referendum. Why Eurosceptics may compromise to get Brexit over the line.  @ChathamHouse
author: patrickwintour

text: All beasts are born bigly...
author: patrickwintour

text: At the risk of non-pc zoomorphism, @johnmcdonnell is turning all big beast on us. Large vision and policy ideas (some good, some less so)
author: patrickwintour

text: also details have yet to be agreed further meeting in November
author: patrickwintour

text: Are there not some details about OPCW attribution powers to be agreed at further OPCW meeting before a decision in principle comes into force ?  Agree OPCW inspectors were delayed in Douma by Syrian regime and still no final report completed.
author: patrickwintour

text: Emily Thornberry says the UK should not take any military action in event of claims of a chemical attack in Idlib until a) OPCW has confirmed such an attack has taken place and attributed responsibility b) secured MPs support in a vote.  Not sure OPCW yet has attribution powers.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK Brexit Dept rejects a Freedom of Information request from Reuters on whether it has sought legal advice on staging a second referendum, or reversing Article 50,   Says not in the public interest and would weaken UK negotiating position. Preposterous.
author: patrickwintour

text: Len McCluskey Unite General Secretary  to tell TUC  that a general election best way to deliver the proper jobs-first Brexit which is the only responsible way to honour the 2016 referendum result.  Says People Vote has happened in 2016 but the option should be kept on table.
author: patrickwintour

text: Second outraged UK foreign office minister @AlistairBurtUK condemns the language used by former boss @BorisJohnson. Not everyone in the foreign office shared Johnson's view of the art of persuasion.
author: patrickwintour

text: Not a lot of love around in the Tory Party this Sunday
author: patrickwintour

text: Very powerful piece written by the Guardian’s former Middle East correspondent @kshaheen on the fruitless wait for justice in Syria.  “3 Million People With Nowhere to Go”
author: patrickwintour

text: Salvini surging in Italy. Populist landslide in European Parliament elections next year more likely.
author: patrickwintour

text: In UN debate consensus that AQ-linked groups operate in Idlib, even if disagree over numbers. Dispute is whether Russian efforts to erase will be proportionate and targeted at solely these groups. As UK Ambassador @KarenPierceUN said more babies than terrorists live in Idlib.
author: patrickwintour

text: Vince Cable's reforms set up Lib Dems to be taken over - no need to be a member to join, no need to have been a member for 12 months to stand to be MP, no need to be a MP to be leader.  Recalling Marx, many will refuse to join a club that is so willing to have them as a member.
author: patrickwintour

text: Saving Idlib from Destruction https://www.crisisgroup.org/middle-east-north-africa/eastern-mediterranean/syria/b63-saving-idlib-destruction … via @crisisgroup
author: patrickwintour

text: Headline in the Irish Times. “NI Secretary didn’t realise nationalists don’t vote for unionists”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Not if going through different channels at the same time. This explanation has been pointed out many times.
author: patrickwintour

text: Mike Gapes Labour MP in the Commons debate on Global Britain backed by Tory MP @IoWBobSeely mounts strong attack on Labour adviser Seumas Milne saying broadly he has dissembled on behalf of Vladimir Putin.
author: patrickwintour

text: Russian embassy doing what it does best. Asking questions.
author: patrickwintour

text: MPs by chance debating Russia today. This from foreign affairs committee MP @IoWBobSeely is one of the most developed counter strategies via Conservative Home
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump never wanted to expel Russian diplomats in a show of solidarity with UK over Skripal poisoning, Trump official claims in anonymous NYT article. Episode has often cited by UK that Trump is true friend.
author: patrickwintour

text: The Russian embassy says UK has not made any official request for assistance from Russia in Skripal case or given any additional information on the suspects such as passport numbers, details of visa applications etc.
author: patrickwintour

text: The British and German governments have abandoned key Brexit demands, potentially easing the path for the U.K. to strike a deal with the EU   - a version of the latest excellent Eurasia Group report on Brexit.   https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-09-05/germany-u-k-said-to-drop-key-brexit-ask-easing-path-to-deal … via @bpolitics
author: patrickwintour

text: Crown Prosecution Statement on why not seeking extradition of 2 Russian suspects in Skripal.
author: patrickwintour

text: BRITISH PROSECUTORS NAME THE TWO RUSSIANS SUSPECTED OF MURDERING SKRIPALS AS ALEXANDER PETROV AND RUSLAN BOSHIROV. MAY TO MAKE STATEMENT AT 12.30.
author: patrickwintour

text: The lengthy statement put out yesterday by the Russian embassy in London setting out their view that UK government is in breach of international law by its denial of access to Skripal family. More may follow.
author: patrickwintour

text: The party on which Mrs May’s Brexit depends.  “DUP’s bitter divisions laid bare by top civil servant: Bell’s late night, alleged bullying and travel row”
author: patrickwintour

text: Bob Woodward extract. After Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad launched a chemical attack on civilians in April 2017, Trump called Mattis and said he wanted to assassinate the dictator. ‘Let’s fucking kill him! Let’s go in. Let’s kill the fucking lot of them".  Mattis ignored him.
author: patrickwintour

text: Cordial and positive meeting between the Italian populist Matteo Salvini and Tony Blair. Considering a conference on investment in Africa.  They discussed Brexit, energy investment and migration.
author: patrickwintour

text: Alistair Burt, FCO minister, pressed by many MPs to ban arms sales to Saudi. Says British hand is in publication of "unparalleled" Saudi report admitting detailed culpability for Aug 9 bus attack. Adds Saudi & UK rejects parts of UN report accusing Saudi of indiscriminate attacks
author: patrickwintour

text: First big affiliated union - the GMB - backs People's Vote. It consulted its members.
author: patrickwintour

text: Mattel Salvini repeats thinly coded attack on France for messing up Libya. Offers to return to Tripoli. He is notionally the Interior Minister, but acts as if prime minister.
author: patrickwintour

text: Recognising that issues such as migration are driving voters to the right, a new movement/party to realign the left will be revealed today ... in Germany.
author: patrickwintour

text: How Europe’s Populist Fifth Column cannot be trusted by European intelligence agencies by Guy Verhofstadt.  Reads like a warmup dividing line for European Parliament elections. @ProSyn
author: patrickwintour

text: Hundreds of prisoners escape from Tripoli jail amid militia fighting
author: patrickwintour

text: 'A blow to press freedom': world reacts to jailing of Reuters journalists in Myanmar
author: patrickwintour

text: UK foreign secretary @Jeremy_Hunt says he will travel to Burma where he will raise the issue of imprisoned Reuters journalists. “Imprisoning journalists who write about inconvenient truths is an unconscionable blow to press freedom, and indeed everyone’s freedom".
author: patrickwintour

text: Matteo Salvini to meet Tony Blair -  Populist meets Globalist. https://www.repubblica.it/politica/2018/09/01/news/salvini_incontra_blair_lo_strano_incontro_al_viminale-205398985/ … via @repubblica
author: patrickwintour

text: Part of UK foreign office statement in wake of Saudi admission of culpability in August 9 attack in Yemen. Still no sign of end to UK granting of arms export licences for sales to Saudi.
author: patrickwintour

text: Momentum to consult members on Brexit but, according to this release, not yet clear whether a chief point of controversy - approach to a 2nd referendum - is included in consultation.
author: patrickwintour

text: Obama ends McCain eulogy with Hemingway: “Today is only one day in all the days that will ever be. But what will happen in all the days that will ever come can depend on what you do today.”   An ostracised Donald Trump meets the challenge by going to play a round of golf.
author: patrickwintour

text: Peoples Vote now dropping its polling into European press - part of a move to persuade European politicians Brexit can be stopped.
author: patrickwintour

text: The Corbyn leadership have dismissed Field's departure, but if @MikeGapes quits, Labour faces serious split. Labour to his core. Natural loyalist. Started political life in party headquarters under Foot & Kinnock, including as international secretary.
author: patrickwintour

text: Since we are exchanging speeches by Macron,  this is the address he made to diplomats this week now in English via French embassy in London.
author: patrickwintour

text: Interesting and more subtle than "Macron changes tack on Brexit" or "Macron throws May lifeline" stories simplified from Times splash by same author. The concentric circles formula was in Macron speech to his diplomats this week and not about Brexit, but broader future of Europe.
author: patrickwintour

text: If you feel swamped by Brexit polls, John Curtice explains why we need more tracking polling to know whether the public are embracing the idea of a further referendum on outcome of the Brexit deal.
author: patrickwintour

text: Michael Cohen told Congress he doesn’t know if Trump knew about Russia meeting.
author: patrickwintour

text: Jeremy Hunt asked on Fox about the possibility of a state visit by Donald Trump to the UK any time soon. “We would love to welcome him. He is a great friend of Britain.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Asked if @BorisJohnson  would make a great PM, Jeremy Hunt tells Axios: "Boris is someone I would never underestimate. This is a man who has changed the course of British history through his campaigning for Brexit".
author: patrickwintour

text: Saudi Arabia seeks its first death penalty against a female human rights activist  PS UK foreign secretary said Tuesday Saudi Arabia keeps Britain's streets safe.
author: patrickwintour

text: Opinion | Why Theresa May is a great prime minister
author: patrickwintour

text: What young Jewish Labour voters think about Corbyn
author: patrickwintour

text: By being an intelligence partner but no real clarity or detail on this
author: patrickwintour

text: Hunt Given importance of online world for political communication, the rules governing online activity in run up to elections should surely be as strict as those elsewhere & electorates given confidence the results cannot be influenced by the cyber activities of other countries.
author: patrickwintour

text: Premier League says it has seen compelling evidence that a   satellite channel partly owned by Saudi Arabia is linked to a year long piracy of Qatar's expensive right to broadcast English football. Saudi happy to risk the odd red card if Qatar defeated.
author: patrickwintour

text: New foreign secretary Jeremy Hunt treading a fine line. His speech challenges the way elections risk being manipulated by populists, fake news, social media and Russian interference. Yet any hint that Trump's mandate is tarnished is poison in the White House.
author: patrickwintour

text: As UK enters third day discussing Boris Johnson, this from Clinton campaign team about the perils of the Trump trap has echoes.
author: patrickwintour

text: Saudi Arabia’s foolish diplomatic expulsion is designed to have consequences well beyond Canada.  Interesting to see how many other countries call Saudis out. via @globeandmail
author: patrickwintour

text: Delightful by @PickardJE
author: patrickwintour

text: Insurmountable lead for ZANU PF with one large province in Zimbabwe to announce.  Now the row about the scale of the fix.
author: patrickwintour

text: As UN Special Envoy announces Yemen talks in Geneva starting September 6 notable US Ambassador to UN warns Saudi coalition in wake of deadly strikes in Hodeida today that it must not show a disregard for civilians. Absurd at one level, but sign US expects Saudi to attend talks.
author: patrickwintour

text: On the day that Martin Griffiths UN Special Envoy is due to inform the UN Security Council of his peace plan for Yemen, a Saudi led air strike is reported to have killed 26 and injured 35 outside hospital and fish market in Hodeidah.
author: patrickwintour

text: German lead co-ordinator on Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: Due to Brexit @KateHoeyMP may not be popular with many in Labour but she is knowledgeable about Zimbabwe, and putting pressure on UK to express more than concern at election conduct.
author: patrickwintour

text: Responding to reports, People's Vote campaign issue statement urging EU leaders not to back a vacuous EU-UK deal or "blind Brexit". Deferring difficult negotiation decisions will only help Brexiteers. Says EU leaders misreading UK. Risk of MPs voting for no deal receding by day.
author: patrickwintour

text: Pressure on international election observers to declare Zimbabwe election result  neither free or fair.
author: patrickwintour

text: Remain campaigners onto the risk that May and Barnier will, for their own reasons, be happy to fudge it. A blind Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: Important piece reporting Germany now happy for EU-UK to agree only a vague declaration on future relations. Makes deal more likely and what some in UK's Remain campaign long feared. https://www.ft.com/content/483d9aa2-9310-11e8-b67b-b8205561c3fe … via @financialtimes
author: patrickwintour

text: Go to stabilisation unit on gov UK and then to elites and syntheses if not visible send me further
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign Office looks at past foreign policy interventions including Libya, and concludes rushing to set up new democratic institutions from scratch may not work. Sometimes better to include and talk to unsavoury power brokers.
author: patrickwintour

text: Commissioned by UK Stabilisation Unit, this report has many lessons post Libya and Iraq for future UK military and diplo interventions. UK has to be more pragmatic about talking to unsavoury power brokers and less focussed on state building.
author: patrickwintour

text: William Hague former Conservative leader clears his throat in Telegraph before saying he agrees with ⁦plan by @TomBaldwin66⁩ ex Labour spinner “in recent book” (plug) to ban paid political ads on line. Next Hague backs 2nd ref ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Plenty of problems ahead with scrutinising suspicious returns from Zimbabwe election - even if Opposition leader @nelsonchamisa is claiming he has won an extraordinary victory.
author: patrickwintour

text: As many as 40 different international election observer groups in Zimbabwe today. A task to co-ordinate their assessment of fairness of vote on Tuesday/Wednesday. Zimbabwe Electoral Commission not seen as independent.
author: patrickwintour

text: It is a crushing moment when you move from senior to veteran. There is no way back. Am still hoping you can graduate further to distinguished.
author: patrickwintour

text: When did you graduate to veteran?  Condolences.
author: patrickwintour

text: The sudden truce in a transatlantic trade war.  Good on how little the EU conceded, and how much Trump was under domestic pressure.
author: patrickwintour

text: Not sure Corbyn’s “Jobs First Brexit” making much sense yet on the Left. Interesting to hear how this debates goes. The tide can move quite fast now.
author: patrickwintour

text: No much longer just thought the  that’s us was funny. Serious story about Banks diamond mines Lesotho and Russia.  Too complicated to tweet and too libellous
author: patrickwintour

text: Channel 4 press release “Arron Banks in a statement to C4 News said he “had genuine concerns about the sanity and mental health of the editorial team responsible for the reports which the programme (that’s us) has broadcast”.
author: patrickwintour

text: Without any discernible interlude, Theresa May seems to have gone from kicking cans down the road to stockpiling them. One a consequence of the other.
author: patrickwintour

text: Relief from UK as it hails US declaration condemning the Russian illegal annexation of Crimea and retention of sanctions. Clearly UK lobbied to prevent any backsliding by Trump.
author: patrickwintour

text: Pompeo ahead of testimony to Senate foreign relations committee today rejects Russian annexation of Crimea and says Russia has chosen to isolate itself. One of Trump’s bridges to Putin blown up.
author: patrickwintour

text: Zimbabwe vote next week - polls say close. Would army accept defeat ?  More than 40 election monitoring missions due. Many say “Even before the vote, Zimbabwe’s election is not credible”
author: patrickwintour

text: John Bolton National Security Adviser says Trump tweet on Iran was considered. " I spoke to the President over the last several days, and President Trump told me that if Iran does anything at all to the negative, they will pay a price like few countries have ever paid before.”
author: patrickwintour

text: This poll hardly a rebuff for Remain.  Deeper worry is if opinion becoming more divided and entrenched.
author: patrickwintour

text: Brilliant honest funny reflections -  Nick Clegg on trying to be effective in government.  Already seems light years away if only due to Ministers thinking about more than Brexit.   https://www.instituteforgovernment.org.uk/ministers-reflect/person/nick-clegg/ … #ministersreflect via @instituteforgov
author: patrickwintour

text: Putin tells diplomats he made Trump a new offer of a referendum on Ukraine at their summit https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-07-19/putin-said-to-have-made-trump-a-new-offer-on-ukraine-at-summit … via @bpolitics
author: patrickwintour

text: This seems a strange way by the Italian government to portray Libyan detention camps.  Am sure some are receiving investment, but to portray them as holiday camps seems premature.
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign Office admits it is worst government department for pay
author: patrickwintour

text: Emily Thornberry shadow foreign secretary being deployed in Jeremy Corbyn’s own constituency party to see off calls to back a referendum on terms of Brexit deal. Says leaving EU breaks her heart but she is a democrat.
author: patrickwintour

text: Interesting to see how the Saudi Media and Research Group use the Independent's editorial content on Saudi human rights record etc. Could be great for press freedom in some of these countries, or could be otherwise. Saudi Arabia & press freedom currently distant cousins.
author: patrickwintour

text: Democrats seeking access to the the notes of the murky private meeting between Trump and Putin in Helsinki.  Some detail on Syria file here.  https://m.aawsat.com/english/english/home/article/1336466/putin%25E2%2580%2599s-envoy-tehran-implement-%25E2%2580%2598helsinki%25E2%2580%2599-decisions …
author: patrickwintour

text: Honoured this week to meet 93-year-old Andrew Mlangeni, tried alongside Nelson Mandela and jailed on Robben Island. Incarcerated for 26 years and 4 months. "I did not want to spend a day in jail, but I did not hate my jailers. We thought we should educate them". #MandelaDay
author: patrickwintour

text: Putin referred to an agreement to co-operate more militarily in the press conference, but the absence of a communique leaves one looking at briefings, interviews etc.   Plus Trump remarks at press conference were by his own admission incoherent.
author: patrickwintour

text: Point v taken but think will come down eventually to hard Brexiteers knowing a) no deal has no Commons majority and b) deadlock leads to referendum Therefore end up with a version of today’s spatchcocked majority taking UK legally out of EU, esp if EU sugarcoats May’s exit deal.
author: patrickwintour

text: Fair point. But every time there is a critical vote she just survives. Tory Brexiteers in Autumn still have the carrot of ensuring the UK in legal terms leaves the EU. There is no majority for No Deal, but if they choose deadlock, increasing chance they end up with a referendum.
author: patrickwintour
