text: On the basis now of repeated Brexit votes, Theresa May has a small majority to get her version of Brexit through Commons this Autumn. Three to five Labour Brexiteers, the DUP and some nervous Tory Remainers gives her a Commons majority.
author: patrickwintour

text: Obama says does not know how to start with people that describe climate change as "an elaborate hoax". He condemns politicians' "utter loss of shame". He said "Caught in a lie, they just double down and lie some more".
author: patrickwintour

text: Obama "For democracy to work we have to believe in an objective reality,  you have to believe in facts.  Without facts there is no basis for cooperation.  If I say this is a podium and you say this is an elephant, it is going to be hard for us to cooperate".
author: patrickwintour

text: Obama "Don't you think these people so intent on putting people down and pumping thesleves up are small hearted - that there is something they are just afraid of". No idea to whom he is referring.
author: patrickwintour

text: Obama praises the multicultural roots of French football team "Not all of those folks look like Gauls to me but they are French" #MandelaLecture
author: patrickwintour

text: Released overnight President Putin’s interview with Fox News -   He reveals Trump did not abandon Crimea. Trump failure lies in his incoherent opening statement that set out no red lines on terms of future relationship with Russia.
author: patrickwintour

text: The Commons vote was about a choice between two versions of Brexit in which the Liberal Democrats do not believe, but ultimately it was an opportunity to defeat a tottering government on Brexit, so you have to be there to take it.
author: patrickwintour

text: Breitbart lobbying prompted US envoy to raise Tommy Robinson case with British Ambassador, Reuters reports.
author: patrickwintour

text: Vote Leave says it repeatedly made it clear they were willing to be interviewed by Electoral Commission. The legal counsel for the EC says Vote Leave refused to co-operate. Would have thought senior cabinet members would never condone obstruction of the law.
author: patrickwintour

text: The philosophy of a President.
author: patrickwintour

text: Asked to accept the US intelligence judgement that Russia interfered with 2016 election, Trump equivocates. He says Putin had made an incredible offer to monitor Russian investigation into  allegations concerning its agents. Trump said Putin had been very powerful in his denial.
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump says he can work with Putin in Syria to create safety for Israel.  Few specifics. Putin wants to work to encourage refugees to return.
author: patrickwintour

text: Putin "I wanted Trump to win because he spoke about normalising Russian relations".
author: patrickwintour

text: Putin agrees no collusion says it is absurd and demands evidence of Russian interference. Says he has not yet studied issue of 12 named Russian agents. Mueller can ask to be present as Russians officials  conduct investigations on his behalf, so long as Russia given same right
author: patrickwintour

text: Theresa May says there is "a growing recognition" that Nord Stream 2  is an issue that needs to be addressed. Still pulls her punches with Germany on the effect of the pipeline on Ukraine's future finances and European dependence on Russian energy.
author: patrickwintour

text: Russian referendum in Crimea has the same legitimacy as UK referendum on Falklands Islands, says Sergei Lavrov, the Russian foreign minister. Will Trump in talks with Putin in Helsinki agree ?  http://www.mid.ru/en/foreign_policy/news/-/asset_publisher/cKNonkJE02Bw/content/id/3294860 …
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson article in Telegraph claims Global Britain is not a vacuous phrase, and Britain is a soft super power. General tub thumping about UK diplomatic and military achievements. Pretty vapid return to well remunerated journalism.
author: patrickwintour

text: Tom Watson Labour deputy leader says there is “a very tiny chance” of Labour supporting a second referendum but accepts party might support if there is an impasse in the Commons.
author: patrickwintour

text: Big moment inside Tory Party. Places pressure on Corbyn to create the Commons majority for 2nd referendum
author: patrickwintour

text: Tony Blair’s latest on Brexit and how May’s Inbetweener solution is the worst of all worlds. Warns no majority for any option in  commons. “We are stuck”.  http://institute.global/news/the-inbetweener-brexit?utm_source=share-twitter&utm_content=The%20%E2%80%98In-Betweener%E2%80%99%20Solution%20is%20the%20%E2%80%98Worst%20Of%20All%20Worlds%E2%80%99.%20Parliament%20Should%20Reject%20It ….
author: patrickwintour

text: The President of the US provides further insights into his thinking about the UK.
author: patrickwintour

text: The Guardian view on Donald Trump in Britain: this was the visit from hell | Editorial
author: patrickwintour

text: Indictment charges 12 Russian military officers by name for conspiring to interfere with the 2016 presidential election.
author: patrickwintour

text: Her Majesty: "Mr President, I am so sorry to hear of the new indictment. Two sugars or one?"
author: patrickwintour

text: Donald Trump will be drinking tea with the Queen when this announcement is made.  Will have some bearing on the rest of his trip.
author: patrickwintour

text: May refuses to say what UK posiiton is on Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline, and Europe's dependence on Russian energy.  UK needs Merkel's help in Brexit talks, so no criticism of Merkel, or agreement with Trump's criticism.
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump reveals he apologised to Theresa May about the Sun interview.
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump on May's options in Brexit talks: "She can't walk away. She's stuck. Can't walk away. She can do other things. She can do what my suggestion says. My suggestion was respectfully submitted." Never reveals the suggestion.
author: patrickwintour

text: The key Trump volte face on feasability of US-UK trade deal. "I read reports where that won't be possible but I believe after speaking with the prime minister's people and representatives and trade experts it will absolutely be possible". Adds “..the trade is a little bit tricky"
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump says he has met Putin 2 and a half times.  Which half of Trump met him ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump makes a recommendation to Europe on mingration. "They better watch themselves. You are changing culture."
author: patrickwintour

text: Recommended etc
author: patrickwintour

text: Hope this is read by some people around the White House and Republican Party. It will have been written/endorsed by former Conservative chancellor and friend of US. Losing allies by the day.
author: patrickwintour

text: "Most of her comments were not audible".
author: patrickwintour

text: Bruno Le Maire French finance minister in Le Figaro on Brexit and the City of London. "I am confident that we will have more relocation announcements in the coming months".
author: patrickwintour

text: Former US Ambassador to EU in Obama administration. PS he is wrong about state visit. Pretty sure the Queen will make sure POTUS never gets one after this  performance.
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson’s Great Leap Forward
author: patrickwintour

text: Sir Alan Duncan foreign office minister claims white paper setting out terms of Brexit not published at time of Sun interview.  “There is no reason practically or legally why a trade deal cannot happen” Trump not rude, just a controversialist. So far trip is a success.
author: patrickwintour

text: Either out the loop, in denial or treating Sun interview as Trump’s opening bid in a trade negotiation.
author: patrickwintour

text: “I told May how to do Brexit but she wrecked it — US trade deal is off” Disastrous Trump interview for May.  She has been totally skewered.  Possible for her to mount reprisal, but at incalculable cost to US relationship
author: patrickwintour

text: US UK France and Italy issue statement re Libya, oil revenues and greater transparency from central bank.
author: patrickwintour

text: Steve Bannon in London hosting Europopulists and like his former boss Donald Trump questioning "a half-in, half-out" Brexit. https://www.politico.com/story/2018/07/11/bannon-london-trump-populists-714067 … via @politico
author: patrickwintour

text: Handling unprecedented unpredictability: UK government hopes the Great Disruptor will not back Hard Brexit or leave UK isolated over Russia.
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump's spokesman in the UK, apparently.
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump said an interesting question whether to recognise Russian claim to Crimea.“People like to say Crimea, but the fact is that they built bridges to Crimea. Big bridge. What will happen with Crimea from now on I can’t tell you, but that was on Obama’s watch, not Trump’s watch."
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump "I would say Brexit is Brexit. The people voted to break it up so I would imagine that's what they would do, but maybe they're taking a different route - I don't know if that is what they voted for."  The UK was "getting at least partially involved back with the EU".
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump on Afghanistan "the war has been going on for a long time" He is now discussing the Kurds.  "They are great people".   No mention of owning any property in Kurdistan.
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump says he has great friends in the UK and "a lot of property".   On Brexit  The people voted to break it up, maybe they will take a little different route.  There might be protests, but I believe the people in the UK like me a lot and agree with me on immigration".
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump on Putin neither a friend or enemy, but a competitor.   "He represents Russia. I represent the US."  Hopefully one day he will be a friend,
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump on visit to UK "I am going to a hot spot with a lot of resignations".  Adds who knows what is going on with the Brexit negotiations.
author: patrickwintour

text: To think England will next be playing World Cup tournament football in Qatar ...and politicians will still be debating  the terms of UK’s departure from EU. The future starts here.
author: patrickwintour

text: John Kerry pinpoints Trump's ability to fawn over enemies and trash his allies on camera. It seems an age ago, but the State Department once did diplomacy. Now Europe just a cheap punchbag in Trump's ugly re-election campaign.
author: patrickwintour

text: Germany and Russia gas links: Trump is not only one to ask questions
author: patrickwintour

text: You noticed I changed the headline. I think the sub editor was trying to prevent derisory reader traffic
author: patrickwintour

text: Balkan states 'must embrace reform before EU accession'  - my forlorn attempt to write about the West Balkans summit itself, and not its absent host, or Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump lambasted German backing for Nordstream 2 gas pipeline. UK govt position most recently set out here, as is strong view of @TomTugendhat chair of foreign affairs select committee that pipeline will strengthen Russia and should not go ahead. https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2018-06-26/debates/539D4D0F-835B-45B5-8491-26F2EDB6AD7F/NordStream2 …
author: patrickwintour

text: US ambassador to London - UK not in turmoil, but will facilitate meeting between President and Boris Johnson if asked.  Unable to rule out the President pulling US troops out of Germany. Upward trajectory of NATO spending not yet steep enough. Uncomfortable interview.
author: patrickwintour

text: Talented French team managed by the equivalent of Tony Pulis.
author: patrickwintour

text: Brexit at all costs.
author: patrickwintour

text: Not if it’s spelt like that.
author: patrickwintour

text: Determined to go - very impressed by the foreign minister. Although that may not be a clincher for everyone in terms of a holiday destination.
author: patrickwintour

text: Continuing on the theme of media freedom in the Balkans, Downing Street prearranged the media that could ask Theresa May questions.  It was the Daily Mail and Sky News that in one of the freak chances came out ahead in the tombola.
author: patrickwintour

text: At Balkans summit Angela Merkel raised her eyebrows and gave out a thin smile when told by Theresa May she was not to answer questions from the British press, and only take a solitary question from a German reporter. One summit issue was media freedom in the Balkans.
author: patrickwintour

text: Not yet
author: patrickwintour

text: Donald Tusk, EU President, advises US: "Please respect your allies. You don't have that many."
author: patrickwintour

text: German Dept FM Michael Roth says rarely hears the view in the EU now that someone thinks they can solve problems by leaving the club. “That’s the only healthy shock that I can see right now in relation to Brexit. Otherwise, it’s a bad, sad and depressing situation”.
author: patrickwintour

text: EU commissioner Hahn adds UK can still have a role through security issues in the Balkans. Brexit need not change this.
author: patrickwintour

text: Asked to comment on the chaos surrounding the hosts of the West Balkans summit,  EU enlargement commissioner Hahn suggests it is a good idea for such future summits to be held in the Balkans itself.
author: patrickwintour

text: Asked why Macedonia wanted to join the EU at the time of UK departure, the foreign minister for Macedonia Nikola Dimitrov suggests "perhaps those inside forget how cold it is outside".
author: patrickwintour

text: EU enlargement commissioner Johannes Hahn said across the Balkans he faces "a reluctance to address rule of law issues" citing judiciary, free media and corruption. "We need statesmanship in the region". EU member states "are becoming more and more impatient on this issue".
author: patrickwintour

text: Britain's answer to populism is Not Sure, and in new polling is starting to surge.  They are thought to be a splinter group from the long established more hard line Don't Know party, but their origins are necessarily uncertain.
author: patrickwintour

text: Now or Never.
author: patrickwintour

text: It is “highly highly unlikely” that Labour will support a People’s Vote on Brexit says Tom Watson Labour deputy leader, adding he cannot recall what Labour’s six tests are.  But he had a decent joke about Boris and Love Yourself Island.
author: patrickwintour

text: It was a Ukraine reform conference following one held in Britain last year.  My bad.
author: patrickwintour

text: My mistake the naked swimmers were in Copenhagen
author: patrickwintour

text: A press conference on the Balkans without Boris Johnson. Sir Alan Duncan the Europe Minister fills the void. In his opening remarks he makes no mention of his departed boss or the Balkanisation of the Conservative government.
author: patrickwintour

text: Do not see why Michael Gove's fear of flying should preclude his appointment as foreign secretary. The UK has had vegetarian agriculture secretaries, transport secretaries without a driving licence and chain smoking health secretaries. Gove could travel by gunboat.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hosting the West Balkans summit was the foreign office's big symbolic push to show its commitment to Europe after Brexit.  Unfortunately typical of his stewardship of the foreign office that machinations over Brexit undid this ambition.
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson has resigned as Theresa May thanks him for his work.   He was due to host the West Balkans Summit in London dedicated to helping the Balkan states prepare for EU membership through better governance. Not sure UK has much to teach anyone on good governance.
author: patrickwintour

text: The best sympathetic account of the thinking behind Davis resignation at the end highlights the many pitfalls in his strategy.  Conservative Home
author: patrickwintour

text: Of course, Brexit does not mean UK is in a world of its own.  But foreign secretary Johnson is locked in English country house without a phone deciding whether to resign, so he misses critical Iran deal talks in Vienna.  Junior minister attends. #globalbritain
author: patrickwintour

text: Austrian leader in favour of extending Brexit talks
author: patrickwintour

text: From today’s Eurasia Group note. Bleak.
author: patrickwintour

text: "Transit centres are not prisons. In these centres, everyone can circulate freely. The only thing is that you do not have the right to do is leave. " Stephan Mayer (CSU), Secretary of State to the German Minister of the Interior. Via @ThomasWieder.  Hotel California in Bavaria.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sweden's principles extended to the Round of 16.  "The better we play, the fewer principles we have".
author: patrickwintour

text: Wiltshire police statement “Major incident declared following ongoing incident in Amesbury” https://www.wiltshire.police.uk/article/2913/Major-incident-declared-following-ongoing-incident-in-Amesbury#.Wzxl-T7xSO8.twitter …
author: patrickwintour

text: Unite policy for its conference will have been sorted many weeks ago. Remain's lack of political organisation in major unions an oversight by Remainers. Corbyn Brexit policy still susceptible to pressure if it is shot full of holes.
author: patrickwintour

text: Unite policy on freedom of movement post Brexit. "Any UK employer wishing to recruit labour abroad should only be able to do so if those workers are covered by a genuine trade union agreement, or by sectoral collective bargaining when they arrive in the UK".
author: patrickwintour

text: Russian led attacks in South West Syria have caused displacement of 271,800 people pushing refugees to the borders of Israel and Jordan, foreign office minister Alistair Burt confirms. Says UK has no real leverage in Syria.
author: patrickwintour

text: The proportion of migrants making the journey from Libya to Europe recorded dead or missing rose to one in ten in the past month. Perhaps a statistical freak, but perhaps populism has its consequences.
author: patrickwintour

text: Details of Brexit poll of Unite membership that Unite general secretary said today he need take no notice since commissioned by anonymous outsiders. It was commissioned by Open Britain. Worth studying poll's message, as well as the messenger.  http://d25d2506sfb94s.cloudfront.net/cumulus_uploads/document/wb96oamqk2/OpenBritainResults_180630_UniteMembers.pdf …
author: patrickwintour

text: Second foreign office minister, after @AlistairBurtUK, to call out the Rees-Mogg Tendency.  Are not these warnings also indirectly aimed at their boss,  the foreign secretary ? Of course it is possible @BorisJohnson is not deemed ideological, so not subject to reproach.
author: patrickwintour

text: Matteo Salvini Italy's populist interior minister promises European elections will be a "referendum between the Europe of the elites, the banks, finance, immigration and precariousness, and the Europe of peoples and work ".
author: patrickwintour

text: UAE foreign minister says its Hodeidah ceasefire is reaching expiry.
author: patrickwintour

text: Corbyn may struggle to win an ambivalent "Workers Brexit" composite motion at Lab conference. Unison & GMB voted at their conferences for single market. Unite may do same this week. This poll of Unite members backs 2nd vote. Unions are 50 % Lab conf vote.
author: patrickwintour

text: More from BBC NI about the secretive organisation that donated so much to the DUP Leave campaign. Given UK may crash out of EU with no deal due to border question, true identity and legality of donor is not just matter of curiosity. Police asleep.
author: patrickwintour

text: Martin Griffiths, UN Yemen Envoy, optimistic after talks with both sides. Believes talks can forestall attack on Hodeidah, lead to UNSC meeting next week and start of wider peace talks in a matter of weeks. Houthis willing for UN to take lead in port. Source UN Radio.
author: patrickwintour

text: The main migration proposal from EU summit - asylum processing centres in Africa - has no support in relevant countries. Libya is in a new political meltdown. Going to take huge bribes via EUs Africa Trust Fund.  http://www.algerieinfos-Saoudi.com/2018/06/apres-la-tunisie-l-algerie-refus-d-abriter-des-centres-de-tri-des-migrants-vers-l-europe.html … via @
author: patrickwintour

text: Why Merkel may yet survive. Austria’s Kurz backs her, and not Italy or her internal German critics. He wants a focus on external borders.
author: patrickwintour

text: ISC on UK outsourcing rendition cases.
author: patrickwintour

text: Intelligence and Security Committee finds evidence of UK complicity in torture post 9-11.
author: patrickwintour

text: This piece is bizarre on so many levels.
author: patrickwintour

text: Those that say Trump would not welcome the destruction of the European Union need to watch.
author: patrickwintour

text: Trump speaking in Fargo overnight “We love the countries of the European Union.  But the European Union was set up to take advantage of the United States, to attack our piggy bank. And you know what? We can’t let that happen.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Prepare for an own goal fest in Belgium v England match. Defeat at all costs.
author: patrickwintour

text: Last time Trump met Putin the two agreed a de-escalation zone in SW Syria. Here, US dept ambassador to UN, speaking today, on how that deal went. Trump got done.  https://usun.state.gov/remarks/8501#.WzPRaTmwOg0.twitter …
author: patrickwintour

text: I think you will find them on the front
author: patrickwintour

text: Joint US UK France Italy statement telling Haftar not to siphon oil revenues for rival East Oil Corps. "These vital Libyan resources must remain under the exclusive control of the legitimate National Oil Corporation and the sole oversight of the Government of National Accord".
author: patrickwintour

text: I aspire to "got it"
author: patrickwintour

text: In 2014 Russia was hailed for its apparent role in ridding Syria of its stockpile of chemical weapons. Today it is reduced to ultimately fruitless procedural devices to block an investigation by a respected international body into repeated violations of CW norms in Syria.
author: patrickwintour

text: Blair at @ChathamHouse "As I was trying to explain to Mr Humphrys when I could get word in...."
author: patrickwintour

text: Inevitable risk that Russia, Syria and Iran etc will pull out of OPCW, the chemical weapons watchdog if vote today expands powers of OPCW to identify users of chemical weapons.  Not good when Great Powers pick and choose the multilateral institutions with which they will work.
author: patrickwintour

text: Still no idea what kind of Democrat is going to face Donald Trump in two year's time. "Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Defeats Joseph Crowley in Major Democratic House Upset".
author: patrickwintour

text: Tony Blair: return to dark 1930s politics no longer far-fetched
author: patrickwintour

text: George Bridges, one of best Tory thinkers on Brexit, sets out the compromises the British government will have to make. Suspect this is close to Tory centre of gravity.
author: patrickwintour

text: Former FCO minister (and big Remainer) on the “collapse of UK foreign policy”. Mark Malloch-Brown @ProSyn
author: patrickwintour

text: What is happening in the Hague at the OPCW looks obscure, but it is not. In essence world no longer has a recognised body to say who used CW in Syria, creating a climate of impunity. OPCW is a good fit to be new body and fill gap. Russia adamantine in refusal to co-operate.
author: patrickwintour

text: Over 2 hours, Russia, Syria & Iran ran well-drilled op at chemical weapons conf. challenging voting procedure, delegates credentials & quorum existence. In a roll-call, 107 countries voted and conf votes 98 to 9 to adopt agenda. Moscow badly isolated in its defence of Syrian CW.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK and Russia set to stage bitter confrontation over UK proposal to extend powers of OPCW so it can attribute responsibility for a chemical weapon attack in Syria.  Russia claims UK will politicise a technical body. UK says unforgivable Russia shields Assad's use of CW.
author: patrickwintour

text: The Guardian praises the Brexit demo and says Brexit is the wrong answer to Brexit's problems.
author: patrickwintour

text: Hungary foreign & trade minister Péter Szijjártó in London “newcomers must understand this is a Christian continent”.  Accuses EU of political blackmail and says EP elections huge opportunity for people to raise voice on migration.
author: patrickwintour

text: Runaway Johnson.
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson “At this important moment when Afghan-led efforts towards a political settlement have gained considerable impetus, I was inspired to be in Kabul to see how the UK is working in support of the Afghan Government to achieve this goal". An inspired visit indeed.
author: patrickwintour

text: How Hedge Funds paid the Brexit pollsters to give them the valuable early info they needed to short the pound. Possibly illegal. Definitely unsavoury.
author: patrickwintour

text: “If Saudi Arabia is to be transformed, and the corrosive grip of fear loosened, it is women who will make that happen” - fine long overview by @NYTimesCohen on what is driving the Saudi elite.
author: patrickwintour

text: There can be cowardice in banality. Many hard questions need addressing in Syria.
author: patrickwintour

text: Major Sanchez interview - on migration, preserving Europe, social democracy, Catalan prisoners, Franco’s remains and Deliveroo workers. The centre Left is not in retreat all over Europe.  Macron has found a much needed ally. https://politica.elpais.com/politica/2018/06/23/actualidad/1529773600_203119.html?id_externo_rsoc=TW_CC … via @elpais_espana
author: patrickwintour

text: Late 2018. UK sets out new negotiating position on Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: Sebastian Kurz Austrian PM wants EU border guards operating on shore in Libya, as well as safe processing centres for asylum claimants outside of prosperous Europe.  Mini-summit on migration tomorrow.
author: patrickwintour

text: Bless.
author: patrickwintour

text: Blair on the methods of modern populism.
author: patrickwintour

text: Blair on responding to populism speaking in Copenhagen at a DefendDemocracy conference.
author: patrickwintour

text: Joe Biden “Rather than some dramatic assault on democracy, however—a putsch or a coup—our institutions and freedoms are slowly being sanded down, little by little. Each step designed to curb institutional safeguards  and concentrate power in the hands of individual leaders.” -
author: patrickwintour

text: One thing that went wrong with democracy possibly is male dominance.  Great discussion with former world leaders from Mexico Canada Spain UK and Estonia but thought we had got past all male panels some years back.
author: patrickwintour

text: Those are big numbers that MPs intend to ignore.
author: patrickwintour

text: The UAE foreign minister on worsening situation in Hodeidah Yemen. Civilians suffering especially if waters runs out
author: patrickwintour

text: From @pennymordaunt speech. Russia a threat, China a challenge, our allies unreliable, pessimism prevails, love in short supply. "At a time when we need to be pulling together we seem to be pulling things apart". But adds "when we leave the EU we need to get our mojo back".
author: patrickwintour

text: Sweden Democrats - anti-migration -  call for referendum on Swedish EU membership after 2018 election & see big boost in poll standing. An incentive for Brussels to make Brexit painful
author: patrickwintour

text: Since UK now says only US decision to leave UN human rights council is regrettable, here is the fine UK Perm Rep in Geneva in 2016 setting out how "the UN is helping to improve human rights in every corner of the world, every day". https://blogs.fco.gov.uk/julianbraithwaite/2016/10/03/the-difference-the-un-makes-on-human-rights/ … via @foreignoffice
author: patrickwintour

text: Nikki Hayley says US is withdrawing UN human rights council describing it as a “hypocritical and self-serving organisation that makes a mockery of human rights”.  Cites chronic bias against Israel and claims US withdrawal removes last shred of organisation’s credibility.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK foreign secretary in Geneva on Monday at UN Human Rights Council "Britain considers this Council to be part of the rules-based international system in which we believe and that we strive to protect".  Trump on Tuesday prepares to pull out.
author: patrickwintour

text: US media reporting Trump will announce US withdrawal from UN Human Rights Council today. Boris Johnson on Monday condemned council's unique singling out of Israel for criticism over occupied Palestine, but praised work of UN.
author: patrickwintour

text: Processing centres for asylum applicants in third countries will be discussed yet again by EU heads of state this week as they wrestle with migrant crisis.  A short history of the legal pitfalls.
author: patrickwintour

text: 15,610 migrants reached Italy by sea in first 24 weeks of 2018. This compares to 68,272 over same period last year. Number of arrivals by sea to Spain in first 24 weeks of 2018 rose to 12,063, close to Italian figure. Total Med. figure down by half.
author: patrickwintour

text: I was thinking about Italy and Germany in the thirties ! But let us hope the thirties is an exception. Five Star should never have given Salvini the interior ministry.   It gives him such a pulpit.
author: patrickwintour

text: The Five Star wing of Italian coalition is bemused that it is being obliterated by the League's attacks on migrants, NGOs and Roma. Historically "populist parties" have a habit of eating their coalition partners.
author: patrickwintour

text: Wow the Nato summit is going to be heavy.   Fortunately for Angela Merkel nothing more calculated to shore up a German politician's support than being insulted by Donald Trump.
author: patrickwintour

text: Never implied you would rebel yourself.  More about how politics is conducted.
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign office minister coming to the defence of the right of the Tory Brexit rebels to act and think as they do.    @AlistairBurtUK is strongly pro-European and widely respected as a Minister.
author: patrickwintour

text: Which England player has more lions on his chest than for his club ? Clue, he is useless.
author: patrickwintour

text: Simon Stevens NHS Chief said Brexit would be disaster for NHS, then, post-Brexit, demanded the cash promised on the battle bus. Does he now collude in the No 10 claim the extra funds are indeed a Brexit dividend ?
author: patrickwintour

text: The populist parties once in government are under pressure to offer their solution to the migration crisis. This proposal from the Italian PM has support in Austria, V4 countries and even Denmark. At worst it ends up with rebranded Libyan detention centres.
author: patrickwintour

text: Aid has been getting a dire press in the UK recently.   Worth remembering how many aid workers risk so much to help others, as in Yemen.
author: patrickwintour

text: UK Governor of the Cayman Islands Anwar Choudhury has been temporarily withdrawn from his post pending investigation into a number of complaints, foreign office confirms. No details given. Only been in post a few months. Interesting character.
author: patrickwintour

text: Theresa May urged in a letter from 40 MPs including chairs of foreign international develop, and human rights select comms to condemn the attack on Hodeida port and use all available means to end the assault, including "withdrawal of material support for combatants".
author: patrickwintour

text: UN Syrian envoy De Mistura to convene Russia, Iran and Turkey to Geneva 18 and 19 June to discuss the composition of a planned constitutional committee, an idea first promoted by Russia in January, but given short shrift by the Syrian regime.
author: patrickwintour

text: UAE briefing its attack on port of Hodeida write to UK MPs it has contingency plans to deliver enough food within a week “to sustain” 600,000 people for a month. “Intensified flow of aid will continue until port is restored”. Port supplies 80 % of Yemen aid.
author: patrickwintour

text: Defending his opposition to MPs retaining a say over the Brexit deal, @DavidDavisMP repeatedly cited this article by Vernon Bogdanor arguing MPs cannot direct international negotiations. The Minister omitted to mention VB’s solution was a 2nd referendum.
author: patrickwintour

text: Yemen: Saudi-led coalition begins battle for vital port
author: patrickwintour

text: Remainers criticising Tory rebels for abstaining mistaken. Rebels got big concessions from PM and revealed their power to enforce them. They also have no interest, personal or political, in alienating colleagues unnecessarily. Doubt EU diplomats will see this as victory for May.
author: patrickwintour

text: PM conceded to rebels a vote after Nov 30 to approve her Brexit strategy if no deal agreed, but she has not yet conceded right for MPs to direct govt if no deal by February 15 when Brexit deadline looms. Grieve says confident MPs will get a meaningful vote on deal and no deal.
author: patrickwintour

text: A government promise of a "structured discussion" on Brexit is inherently implausible.
author: patrickwintour

text: Andrew Mitchell warns "Britain will be complicit in a catastrophe in Yemen. In relation to Saudi Britain has decided commercial and security interests trumps everything else".
author: patrickwintour

text: Andrew Mitchell MP "The UK using its position on the UN security council to advantage the Saudi coalition,  of which Britain loosely is a part. That sort of behaviour may well hasten the necessary reform of the United Nations, as Britain's international credibility declines".
author: patrickwintour

text: Andrew Mitchell MP: "Power in Britain, thanks to the last election, has passed from the cabinet room to the floor of the house of commons. The next few days boils down one issue - the meaningful vote and whether or not the parliament can hold the executive to proper account".
author: patrickwintour

text: A valuable process may have started, but given the thin content of the signed agreement, one can see why Trump did not think he needed to prepare that much for his North Korea summit. The agreement hardly reaches Base Camp 1. https://twitter.com/shashj/status/1006430228846206976 …
author: patrickwintour

text: The meaningful vote - MPs retaining their control over endorsement of final Brexit deal - is only Brexit issue of moment in next 24 hours. Two or three swing Tory MPs, as it stands, will not rebel, & so will hand back control from sovereign parliament to proven wayward executive.
author: patrickwintour

text: Have they inserted a cut-off point on the Hang Tough option.
author: patrickwintour

text: Wrong year, wrong month, wrong city and wrong museum.  Otherwise Arron Banks memory was spot on.
author: patrickwintour

text: You are not being very Global Britain. Millions facing starvation, and you say bring on the second reading of the Widgets (Lords) Repeal bill.
author: patrickwintour

text: The argument is Libya is not a safe place,  but yes agree migration is the biggest issue facing EU. Macron spending a lot of time with African leaders on this, and many Marshall Plans launched, but nothing sufficiently coherent.
author: patrickwintour

text: Always bow to @GuidoFawkes knowledge of Yemen, but Burt can say what he said on twitter yesterday to Saudi & UAE - Don't attack the Yemen port. 10,000 lives at stake. UK has traction - meets with US, Saudi and UAE regularly on Yemen, and UK penholder on issue at UN.
author: patrickwintour

text: New Spanish socialist government to take the drifting Aquarius with more than 600 migrants. Humanitarian gesture that Italian populists will regard as a win for its new Not Welcome Here strategy. . https://elpais.com/ccaa/2018/06/11/catalunya/1528714656_208328.html?id_externo_rsoc=TW_CC … via @el_pais
author: patrickwintour

text: Dominic Cummings on @Arron_banks - a man not to be trusted who would have lost the referendum campaign by 60 to 40 if the donors had capitulated and let him take-over the main Leave campaign. Best left down one of his defunct mines, DC adds.
author: patrickwintour

text: Italy closes its ports, says Malta must take 629 migrants rescued overnight
author: patrickwintour

text: Aid groups in Yemen warned imminent attack could endanger all supplies
author: patrickwintour

text: Since 2016 writer possesses info that damages man for whom ghosting book; does not read info; leaves in attic; summer 2017 reads; realises info important; March 2018 info hacked; still sits on info, only publishes when rival set to do so. Always planned to publish. (Amended date)
author: patrickwintour

text: Looking forward to the explanation of this.  Believe she is writing a book, but still hard to fathom why she thought this critical information should only be published today.
author: patrickwintour

text: Arron Banks ‘met Russian officials multiple times before Brexit vote’
author: patrickwintour

text: At the G7 it looks as if Trump has had a a new idea.
author: patrickwintour

text: Yep.  Think of the number of Brexit explainers, Q&As, charts,  hot takes, analyses and overviews. All defunct. It’s about cheese.
author: patrickwintour

text: Italy run by pro-Russian populists (don't ask) has agreed with Trump that Russia should be alowed back into G7 re-establishing the G8.  Russia was thrown out over Ukraine, but the Italian move blows Europe's anti-Russian alliance.
author: patrickwintour

text: Barnier:"Our backstop cannot be extended to the whole UK. Why? Because it has been designed for the specific situation of Northern Ireland. NI would form part of our customs territory. What is feasible for a territory the size of NI is not necessarily feasible for the whole UK.”
author: patrickwintour

text: Michael Howard confronts Netanyahu over Gaza deaths
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson urges the nation not to panic ahead of the coming meltdown. “It’s going to be all right in the end”.  Churchill’s biographer rehearses, pro bono, the role of war leader.
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson unplugged - contemptuous of May’s caution but admiring of the “method in Donald Trump’s madness”.  Brexit’s darkest day. https://www.buzzfeed.com/alexspence/boris-johnson-trump-brexit-leaked-recording?utm_term=.nd1V4b9JE … via @alexGspence
author: patrickwintour

text: On a day like today when the UK  political traffic went fast in one direction, this view by @oflynnmep deserves hearing.
author: patrickwintour

text: Retaining a "meaningful vote" on final deal is the paramount issue facing MPs next week. IMHO the govt amendment (below) states if MPs reject deal, only obligation on Ministers is to state what they will do  This would leave the executive, not parliament, sovereign.
author: patrickwintour

text: Great political slogans of our time.
author: patrickwintour

text: The question the former Conservative leader Michael Howard today asked Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu.
author: patrickwintour

text: And now "an all-weather backstop" is required.
author: patrickwintour

text: The apotheosis of May-ism. Her ministers unable to agree what it means to set a date for when they expect to stop kicking a can down the road.
author: patrickwintour

text: Netanyahu: "Syria has to understand that Israel will not tolerate the Iranian military entrenchment in Syria... The consequences are there not just for Iran, but the Assad regime too."
author: patrickwintour

text: Michael Howard former Conservative leader asks Netanyahu why he thought the only way to stop Gaza protestors scaling the fence was to kill them. Why did Israel not use rubber bullets ?
author: patrickwintour

text: Netanyahu on Gaza killings "they are not peaceful protestors, they are vicious Hamas terrorists".  Tear gas and water cannons do not work.  Says asked his defence forces to see if new technological solution to control protests could be found.
author: patrickwintour

text: Netanyahu says Russia not turning a blind eye to Israeli strikes against Iran inside Syria.  "They can see very well" - implying Russia have tolerated, if not endorsed strikes.
author: patrickwintour

text: Netanyahu says focus of his trip to Berlin Paris and London has been to get Iran out of Syria. Claims US sanctions have "smashed Iran's aggressive cash machine" since EU firms are pulling out of Iran. "It has been stopped dead in its tracks".
author: patrickwintour

text: Women in majority in the new Spanish socialist cabinet.  Shames the Italian populists that equates anti-elitism with men in every major portfolio.
author: patrickwintour

text: Netanyahu to Israeli press following European tour: “I am finishing three days whose goal was to dismantle the Iranian presence in Syria. This was my main objective – to bring about an international agreement that Iran will leave Syria.” Claims significant advance in this goal.
author: patrickwintour

text: The sentiments below are from the previous Treasury permanent secretary & were retweeted by   @SimonFraser00, the previous Foreign Office permanent secretary. Two v senior former mandarins united and impartial in their contempt for Govt & Opposition.
author: patrickwintour

text: Good deal of Netanyahu/May meeting focused on Israeli desire to see Iran pushed out Syria. British impression is that Israel confident US sanctions are already hitting Iranian economy severely, and Iran will view deal broken soon.
author: patrickwintour

text: UN accuses Saudi Arabia of using anti-terror laws to justify torture
author: patrickwintour

text: On D-Day anniversary, EU announces it will impose retaliatory tariffs on US imports from July.    announcement
author: patrickwintour

text: Chemical weapons watchdog to hold special session in June
author: patrickwintour

text: Remainers deep distrust of Corbyn over Brexit has accumulated over the months and as a result his apparent late shift to a softer Brexit is seen by some MPs as a device to give the impression of opposition to Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text:
Conclusion post-Mandelson/Progress talk.
V likely only a no deal, or a v outline deal, possible by October. EU can shape how favourably May can present this. 
If (unlikely) MPs say no to a Blind Brexit & tell govt to stay in EU until deal clearer, EU will require new UK approach.
author: patrickwintour

text: The head of the GMB speaking very strongly against progress on Brexit -  the union votes on this issue today.  Doubt many GMB members think their industries will benefit from being outside the EU single market.
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign Office chief Sir Simon McDonald says he hopes his department will take control of 1% of UK's £4bn Overseas Development budget for Africa. Says hopes this will emerge from still unpublished Africa Strategy.  Part of effort to revive marginalised FCO post-Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: Diverge on services, stay converged on goods.   Open Europe tries to break the deadlock on a future UK-EU economic partnership | Open Europe
author: patrickwintour

text: Read out of Theresa May and Saudi Crown Prince call discussing the humanitarian consequences of Saudi led effort to seize Hodeida port. Runs counter to UN peace drive. No mention in read-out of Saudi wave of arrests of dissidents.
author: patrickwintour

text: Three large UK unions - Unite, GMB and Unison - all hold annual conferences this month and judging by motions, Brexit policy v similar to Corbyn. Unions hold half vote at Lab conf.  Remain campaign, v. focused on parliament, pretty invisible in unions.
author: patrickwintour

text: Singapore's Defence Minister Dr Ng speaking at a security conference earlier alongside UK Defence Secretary Gavin Williamson.  The Global Britain brand clearly working in Asia.
author: patrickwintour

text: According to this article, it is possible but would involve 5,000 flights, a minimum 10,000 flying days and many billions of Euros that the Italian govt does not have.
author: patrickwintour

text: Funny how the anti-elitist government of Italy chooses to appoint so few women, all bar one placed in relatively junior roles, and then puts them front and centre of the official photo. First false impressions.

author: patrickwintour

text: It is quite nuanced. DFID and MOD remain etc with their technical expertise but foreign office "should be given strategic oversight of a budget of perhaps even up to 5 % of GDP to cover the needs of all the related departments”.
author: patrickwintour

text: FCO reveals it has formally requested that chemical weapons watchdog OPCW next month convene a special Conference.  The purpose will be to strengthen OPCW.  DG of OPCW at Chatham House last week OPCW could take on role of attributing responsibility for CW use.
author: patrickwintour

text: Libyan factions agree to hold credible peaceful parliamentary and Presidential elections on December 10. Aim is to secure a constitutional base (not a constitution) by September. All sides commit to respect elections outcome.
author: patrickwintour

text: Superb on the Italian elite’s strategy of maximising the tension. Forcing the debate on the Euro into the open in this way fraught with risk.
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson 'hobbled by lack of Foreign Office power'
author: patrickwintour

text: Crisis Group warn France’s Libya Summit tomorrow in Paris could backfire and lead to recriminations if it does not galvanise the warring parties into backing elections. "A display of French stubbornness" says one diplomat.    https://www.crisisgroup.org/middle-east-north-africa/north-africa/libya/b58-making-best-frances-libya-summit … via @crisisgroup
author: patrickwintour

text: Knowing him, he probably practices the "roll-over" in training with the coaching staff.

text: Tell that to an Egyptian. Better team won, but thugs should be called out.

text: Just a one off accident that keeps happening involving the same player.
author: patrickwintour

text: Keir Starmer tells @campbellclaret that Labour could vote against Brexit deal if it does not pass his six tests. Not sure this is the way to form Labour policy on Europe, but hey,  a small shaft of grey light is shed in a dark corner.
author: patrickwintour

text: Alastair Campbell contends if May’s deal this Autumn does not pass Labour’s six tests, Labour will still let Brexit through the Commons. These are mock exams.  May can fail the tests and Kier Starmer will still hand her a diploma.
author: patrickwintour

text: The Stars and Stripes missing in the display of flags,  as the remaining signatories to Iran nuclear deal discuss if they can stop the US sanctioning the deal to death.
author: patrickwintour

text: British Virgin Islanders to stage march (!) against public registers of beneficial ownership. Leaders say will resist new UK law imposed on UK govt by Commons.  BVI Beacon
author: patrickwintour

text: Theresa May spoke with leaders of overseas territories over new law requiring public registers of beneficial ownership by 2020.   Aware is a "matter of great concern for the leaders and conscious of the strong reactions the issue had provoked in their territories". Push back.
author: patrickwintour

text: Everything was going so well.
author: patrickwintour

text: Foreign Office explains how after the big Brexit walk-out, its diplomats want to creep back in again, and attend as many EU foreign policy meetings as possible. Splendid isolation looking less splendid, the closer it comes.
author: patrickwintour

text: US sanctions on Russia bite further. Deripaska’s Rusal, world’s largest aluminum producer, loses top-management over US sanctions:
author: patrickwintour

text: Exclusive - Yulia Skripal: Attempted assassination turned my world upside down
author: patrickwintour

text: Yulia Skripal gives her first interview -  to Reuters - says shocked someone sought to poison her and father, hopes one day to return to Russia, says the clinical "treatment was invasive, painful and depressing", does not want help of Russian embassy.
author: patrickwintour

text: FCO minister @AlistairBurtUK "I do believe some of the complaints made about workers rights in Qatar are based more on history than on what is actually happening".  Yet family of only British worker killed building world cup still waiting for a proper explanation from Qatar.
author: patrickwintour

text: One of the great Commons exchanges of Brexit.  How did this max fac proposal for customs ever get anywhere near a cabinet sub-committee if it would cost £20bn a year?  Just makes UK look a negotiating laughing stock.
author: patrickwintour

text: Boris Johnson steps up pressure on Merkel by criticising “divisive” Russia to Germany gas pipeline. Expect UK MPs to take this issue up.
author: patrickwintour

text: I thought Obama but apparently not good enough.  Maybe North Korean President now has spare time if their summit not going ahead

text: What is your handicap?
author: patrickwintour

text: Don't Know in tight race with Won't Say.

text: Add a lot of swearing and twitter form to the Nicholas books, and you get this hilarious description of the horror of a school trip with 10 year olds. Deserves all the love it is getting. h/t @JuliaHB1 (yes her). https://twitter.com/simonfromharlow/status/998470432176123904 …
author: patrickwintour

text: Ministers in Lords confirmed Magnitsky clauses in sanctions bill allowing sanctions against individuals deemed to be guilty of gross human rights abuses can only be implemented after Brexit.

text: great question.   Got to the heart of the problem.

text: Secretary Pompeo sets out the 12 things Iran must do before US will lift new sanctions. Otherwise US will “crush” Iran. If European firms get caught in the mincer, the message basically is “tough”.

author: patrickwintour

text: Security Minister complains not asked to give evidence to foreign affairs select about Russian money. Chief govt witness was Foreign Sect. MPs concluded “There is a clear need for stronger political leadership to show commitment to ending the flow of dirty money into UK”.

text: This official statement from Young Labour national committee explains why it accepts Brexit’s inevitably and opposes further debate of the issue inside Labour’s institutions. Interesting to see if Left can sustain this through Autumn.

text: He just said Russian businessmen were preparing legal action on the basis that guilt by association is no grounds for legal action.  Came in context of the sanctions bill.
author: patrickwintour

text: Delay in Abramovich visa renewal comes ahead of a foreign affairs select committee report tonight, trailed by its chairman, calling for a crack down on Putin oligarchs in London. Russian ambassador told me UK govt risks being sued.

text: Brilliant description by @PaulGoodmanCH of how May finds herself gently boiling the Brexiteer frog | Conservative Home
author: patrickwintour

text: So far 32,324 British people have bought tickets for Russian World Cup, Ambassador discloses. UK has been given permission to run a mobile embassy with 12 officials. Total of 150 foreign police from 32 countries wearing their national uniform.

text: Russian ambassador to UK @Amb_Yakovenko starts his press conference by showing a photograph of where "Britain" will play Tunisia.  Spot of disinformation in there.

text: Former chairman of the Prime Minister's policy board on Brexit. Important.
author: patrickwintour

text: The EU's blocking statute on Iran empowers a sanctioned company to sue for recovery of assets from "the legal person or any other entity causing the damages, or from any person acting on its behalf".  So a sanctioned EU entity could sue US Treasury.  Quite a court case.
author: patrickwintour

text: Russian Ambassador to the UK has one of his now near monthly press conferences today. His answers may occasionally be un-adjacent to the truth, but compared to the UK foreign office, at least, this is Glasnost.
author: patrickwintour

text: Due to Russian veto at UN, world no longer has an internationally recognised body to identify those using chemical weapons, and hold the culpable to account. A by-product of the new cold war. France maintaining profile of issue with conference in Paris today.
author: patrickwintour

text: EU will launch blocking statute tomorrow designed to shield EU firms trading with Iran from US sanctions.  Statute first deployed by EU 22 years ago is untested in courts. Check out these alliances.  Brexiting UK + EU + Iran v US    Israel, Saudi and UAE.
author: patrickwintour

text: EU Budget Commissioner Günther Oettinger on Iran deal "One thing is very clear to me: Trump despises weaklings. If we just step by step give in and submit, so if we become a kind of junior partner of the US, then we would be lost".
author: patrickwintour

text: Did Russia possibly enter the war after Cameron make that assessment, and did you look at the recent figures on the proportion of Russian bombs dropped on IS and on the Opposition.      PS

text: Prospect magazine has just released this extract from an interview with the shadow foreign secretary Emily Thornberry.

text: This looks at first glance primarily like a target rich environment for Labour Remain supporters to tell Jeremy Corbyn what they think of his policy on Brexit.
author: patrickwintour

text: OPCW, the global chemical weapons watchdog in new report confirms chlorine used in Syria's Saraqeb town, Idlib province in February attack. Two cylinders dropped from a helicopter dropped into an open field. OPCW has no power to attribute responsibility.
author: patrickwintour

text: Ahead of EU meeting with Iran on how to avoid US sanctions and protect nuclear deal, the US  treasury strikes.
author: patrickwintour

text: Senior backbench Tory @NSoames  condemns "the limp response of the foreign office" to Israel's "wholly unacceptable use of force" in Gaza. Also condemns the wicked manipulation of Hamas. Another former minister @HugoSwire calls Gaza a festering hell hole due to Israel's blockade.
author: patrickwintour

text: Emily Thornberry urges UK to draft and support a resolution at the UN that calls for an independent investigation into the vicious slaughter in Gaza so those responsible can be held to account. Minister @AlistairBurtUK says UK working at UN on best form of inquiry.
author: patrickwintour

text: Middle east minister @AlistairBurtUK says UK supports an independent investigation into Gaza deaths. Adds the move of the US embassy was "not conducive to peace" and "the timing incredibly difficult".

text: French finance and foreign ministers to meet 60 French firms that trade with Iran to work through details of how to protect their continuing trade with Iran from US secondary sanctions.

UK, targeting Russia, dislikes the rhetoric, and questions its practicality.  http://www.lefigaro.fr/international/2018/05/14/01003-20180514ARTFIG00232-les-etats-unis-abusent-ils-de-leur-hegemonie.php … via @Figaro_Inter

author: patrickwintour

text:
Tessa Jowell’s last words to parliament.  “What gives a life meaning is not only how it is lived but how it draws to a close”.  
Everything became her in her life, including the manner of her leaving it. Few modern-day Labour MPs achieved so much, and none with so much grace.
author: patrickwintour

text: Iran says will only stay inside nuclear deal if Europe "proceeds from giving pledges to taking practical action, without preconditions".  Zarif charged with obtaining required guarantees (EU must resist Trump sanctions).  Zarif due to meet EU foreign ministers now on Tuesday.
author: patrickwintour

text: The whole concept of "a decision" is over-played by lobby journalists like you. Part of your collective obsession with process. Consensus seeking should be regarded as an iterative methodology that has value in itself.
author: patrickwintour

text: it's in the grave, just ahead of me.  But in 10 years do you think Theresa May will be calling a final crunch cabinet meeting on a new AI enhanced version of a Customs Union.

text: Willing to sacrifice a lot in long term national interest, especially to fulfill the vision of a thirty something zealot, but when you reach my age, I am not sure you can afford to regard the next 10 years as irrelevant.

text: The joint statement by European leaders is hardly a clarion call in defence of the Iran nuclear deal, but it amounts to quiet defiance of a President who has described the deal as a decaying and rotten structure based on a giant fiction.

text: Jaish al-Islam fighters will leave Douma for the northern city of Jarablus, near the borders with Turkey, within 48 hours, Syrian state TV reports.   Appears Assad achieved his deadly purpose with the use of chemical weapons. Innocent civilians pay the price.
author: patrickwintour

text: Europeans overwhelmingly suspect Russia was behind the Salisbury poisoning - survey undertaken March 23-26. Russia working hard to swell don’t know column.

text: Karen Pierce, UK envoy to UN hints UK not enthusiastic for US to pull trips from Syria, and says grotesque that Russia still blocks inquiry into CW use in Syria.
author: patrickwintour

text: Entire policy department of US embassy in Russia has been selected for expulsion by Russia.  Key conduit for explaining US policy to Russian government, and vice versa.

text: The Russian envoy to the UN raised the fate of the Guinea pigs at the UN Security Council last night,  but they have died in tragic circumstances taking their secrets to their grave. The cat has been put down.

text: Russian ambassador urges UK to share full results of OPCW inquiry into Skripal poisoning after it is completed, probably next week. Previously Russia has said it will not accept results of OPCW inquiry unless Russia involved in inquiry.

text: Russia said 23 of the 41 countries on the OPCW executive either voted with Russia or abstained in vote on whether to hold a joint Russian-UK investigation into the Salisbury attack.
author: patrickwintour

text: Bolivia may not be on the executive of the OPCW.   The body has 41 members so considerably smaller than UN general assembly but would need to check

text: The 14 strong coalition at the OPCW that backed Russia has a familiar look - Cuba, Pakistan, Iran, Nicaragua, Russia, Venezuela, Syria, Belarus, Armenia, the Stans.

text: UK to OPCW "Russia’s refusal to accept the results of the OPCW’s investigation unless Russian experts participate in it suggests that Russia is opposed to the independence and impartiality of the Technical Secretariat and is nervous about what the results will show".

text: Now US diplomats tell Russian foreign ministry that it stands in "complete solidarity with the UK" accuses Russia of "tried and trusted tactic of denying responsibility, distracting and disinforming". Says US "will hold Russia accountable for its illegal actions".

text: At Russian briefing for diplomats,  Slovakia and Sweden complain about Russian allegations that either country may have been the source of nerve gas   in Salisbury.  Russia says will apologise - no accusation has been made.

text: Russian ministry hit back at French diplomat for expressing solidarity with UK -  "good for you. We understand you were told to say this" then adds "France looks ridiculous" since it has no information.

text: UK diplomat intervenes live on broadcast Russian foreign affairs briefing to diplomats accusing Russia of state assassination and an unlawful act by the Russian state. Russian briefers taken aback and then call for joint investigation. Modern diplomacy.

text:
DIARY OF A NOBODY 
Thursday 30 November: My Special Relationship with President came to end.
Monday December 4 Agreed with Michael Barnier to start next stage of Brexit talks.
Tuesday December 5 Rang Commonwealth Secretary General for a chat. Left message.
